title: A - General Information : General

fields.name: Plan Number
fields.desc: Provide the three-digit plan number (starting at 001 for pension plans) that, with the EIN, uniquely identifies the plan for IRS, DOL, and PBGC. Continue using the same number for all future filings; do not reuse it for another plan.

fields.name: First line of Plan name
fields.desc: Enter the first line of the Plan name. If the second line is blank, the entire Plan name appears on a single line in all documents.

fields.name: Second line of Plan name
fields.desc: Enter the second line of the Plan name if you want the Plan name displayed on multiple lines. If left blank, it appears on one line.

fields.name: Original effective date of Plan (cannot be earlier than the first day of the Plan Year during which Plan is adopted)
fields.desc: Enter the Plan’s initial effective date, not earlier than the first day of the Plan Year in which it was adopted (unless allowed by the SECURE Act). This date follows the format in Global Document Print Settings.

fields.name: Is this a restatement of a previously-adopted plan?
fields.desc: Select “Yes” if the plan restates a previously-adopted plan; otherwise, select “No” for a new plan.

fields.name: Effective date of Plan restatement (cannot be earlier than the first day of the Plan Year during which Plan is adopted)
fields.desc: Enter the restatement’s effective date, which cannot precede the first day of the Plan Year in which the plan is amended. The date follows Global Document Print Settings.

fields.name: This Plan was part of a previous merger
fields.desc: Indicate if this Plan was part of a previous merger.

fields.name: Name of other plan with which this Plan merged (optional):
fields.desc: Enter the name of the other plan involved in the merger, if applicable.

fields.name: Effective date of the plan merger (optional):
fields.desc: Enter the effective date of the plan merger, if applicable.

fields.name: Additional information related to the plan merger (optional):
fields.desc: Provide any additional information about the plan merger, if applicable.

fields.name: Plan Year End (mm/dd)
fields.desc: Enter the Plan Year end date in the selected format. For SIMPLE 401(k) Plans, this must be 12/31.

fields.name: If the Plan Year End is not a simple date, enter the full Plan Year End here. You must still enter the closest simple date in the Plan Year End (mm/dd) field above
fields.desc: If entered, this text prints as the Plan Year End in documents. The simple Plan Year End date is still required for system calculations.

fields.name: The Plan has a Short Plan Year
fields.desc: Indicate if the Plan has a Short Plan Year. A Plan amendment is required for reasons other than the initial Plan Year.

fields.name: Start date of the Short Plan Year (mm/dd/yyyy)
fields.desc: Enter the start date of the Short Plan Year in the selected format.

fields.name: End date of the Short Plan Year (mm/dd/yyyy)
fields.desc: Enter the end date of the Short Plan Year in the selected format.

fields.name: In the event of a Short Plan Year, service conditions will be pro-rated based on months for the following purposes:
fields.desc: Specify if service conditions (e.g., required hours) will be pro-rated during a Short Plan Year. Overlapping computation periods can still allow participants to meet eligibility or vesting if they complete the required hours within the applicable period.

fields.name: If "Other" provide details on proration of service conditions:
fields.desc: Provide any additional details on how service conditions are pro-rated, if different from the standard method.

fields.name: Limitation Year means
fields.desc: Specify the 12-month period used to apply Code section 415 limits. For SIMPLE 401(k) Plans, the Limitation Year must be the Calendar Year.

fields.name: Specify Other Limitation Year (must be a consecutive 12-month period)
fields.desc: Enter the details of the consecutive 12-month period used as the Limitation Year (including permissible 52-53 week fiscal years).

fields.name: The Plan is frozen as to eligibility
fields.desc: Select “Yes” to prevent any new participants from entering the Plan on or after the specified freeze date.

fields.name: Enter the date the Plan was frozen as to eligibility (mm/dd/yyyy)
fields.desc: Provide the date (in the selected format) on which new participant eligibility was frozen.

fields.name: The Plan is frozen as to benefit accruals
fields.desc: Select “Yes” to stop additional contributions or benefit accruals as of the specified date.

fields.name: Enter the date the Plan was frozen as to benefit accruals (mm/dd/yyyy)
fields.desc: Provide the date (in the selected format) on which benefit accruals were frozen.

title: A - General Information : Plan Features

fields.name: Elective Deferrals are permitted
fields.desc: Select “Yes” for a 401(k) plan (allowing elective deferrals). Select “No” for a Non-Elective/Profit Sharing-only plan.

fields.name: Roth Elective Deferrals are permitted
fields.desc: Select “Yes” to allow participants to make Roth after-tax deferrals. Select “No” to disallow.

fields.name: Voluntary (after-tax) Contributions are permitted (If "No", questions regarding Voluntary Contributions are disregarded)
fields.desc: Select “Yes” if participants may make after-tax contributions (required if recharacterization is used). Select “No” if they are not permitted. Select “Formerly Allowed” if they were once permitted but are now discontinued. SIMPLE 401(k) Plans may not allow these contributions.

fields.name: Employer Matching Contributions are permitted (If "No", questions regarding Employer Matching Contributions are disregarded)
fields.desc: Select “Yes” if the plan has or had matching contributions (even if currently suspended), to keep matching options (e.g., vesting, in-service distributions) active. Select “No” otherwise.

fields.name: Non-Elective Contributions are permitted (If "No", questions regarding Non-Elective Contributions are disregarded)
fields.desc: Select “Yes” if the plan has or had non-elective contributions (even if suspended), to maintain related options (e.g., vesting, in-service distributions). Select “No” otherwise.

fields.name: Safe Harbor Contributions are permitted (If "No", questions regarding Safe Harbor Contributions are disregarded)
fields.desc: Select “Yes” if the plan includes safe harbor contributions (current or prior). Select “No” otherwise.

title: A - General Information : SIMPLE 401(k)

fields.name: The Plan is intended to be a SIMPLE 401(k) Plan
fields.desc: Select “Yes” if this is a SIMPLE 401(k) Plan. To qualify, the employer must generally have fewer than 100 employees who earned more than $5,000 in the previous year and must be structured as a sole proprietorship, partnership, or corporation.

fields.name: Amount of compensation to be eligible for SIMPLE Plan (cannot be greater than 5000) without $ sign or comma
fields.desc: For a SIMPLE 401(k) Plan, enter the maximum amount of compensation (up to $5,000) to determine whether the Employer is an eligible employer under Section 4.10(b)(2) of the Basic Plan Document.

title: A - General Information : Effective Dates

fields.name: There is a special effective date for one or more features specified above (Elective Deferrals, Roth, Matching, Non-Elective and/or Voluntary Contributions)
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if a new contribution feature was added mid-year; otherwise, select 'No' if all features were active on the plan’s effective date.

fields.name: Specify the special effective date(s) and the provisions to which it/they apply (effective date for Elective Deferrals cannot be earlier than the date the CODA was adopted)
fields.desc: Provide the specific feature and its effective date (not before the date in A.3a), e.g., 'Roth contributions added on July 1, 2022.'

fields.name: Indicate whether a previous amendment eliminated one of the features specified above (elective deferrals, Roth, Matching, Non-Elective and/or Voluntary Contributions)
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if any contribution feature was removed in a previous amendment, such as matching contributions eliminated on January 1, 2018.

fields.name: Specify the provisions that apply to the eliminated features
fields.desc: Summarize the details of the eliminated feature (e.g., 'Matching Contributions eliminated on January 1, 2018'), and note if elective deferrals are subject to age-based withdrawal conditions per G.4a.

title: A - General Information : Definition of Statutory Compensation

fields.name: Definition of Statutory Compensation:
fields.desc: Defines Statutory Compensation, which determines annual benefit limits, HCE status, and top-heavy benefits. It offers several options—Section 415 Compensation, W-2 Compensation, Withholding Compensation, and Section 415 Safe Harbor Option—with W-2 Compensation required for SIMPLE 401(k) Plans.

fields.name: Include deemed Code section 125 compensation in the definition of Statutory Compensation
fields.desc: Indicate whether amounts under Code section 125, which cannot be substituted for group health coverage, should be included in Statutory Compensation when no health coverage information is collected.

fields.name: Include Post Severance Compensation in the definition of Statutory Compensation
fields.desc: Defines Post Severance Compensation as amounts paid after severance (either 2-1/2 months later or by the end of the relevant period) that would have been included if paid prior to severance. It covers unused accrued leave and deferred compensation under specific conditions.

fields.name: Include Post Year End Compensation in the definition of Statutory Compensation
fields.desc: Defines Post Year End Compensation as earnings accrued in a year but paid in the next due solely to payroll timing, ensuring payments are consistent across employees and not counted twice.

title: A - General Information : Definition of Plan Compensation

fields.name: Add exclusions to definition of Statutory Compensation in order to determine definition ofPlan Compensation for purposes of allocations
fields.desc: Indicate if exclusions are applied to Statutory Compensation to derive Plan Compensation for allocations; select 'Yes' for exclusions and 'No' if none are applied.

fields.name: For Elective Deferrals and Voluntary Contributions
fields.desc: Defines Plan Compensation for Elective Deferrals/Voluntary Contributions used for safe harbor contributions, with a reference to C.16 for including pre-participation pay.

fields.name: Amounts contributed pursuant to a salary reduction which are not includable in gross income under Code sections 125, 402(e)(3), 402(h), 403(b), 132(f), or 457
Certain fringe benefits
Differential military pay
Final Paycheck Pay
fields.desc: Excludes Final Paycheck Pay from Plan Compensation even though it is included in Statutory Compensation. This pay, made after severance (either 2-1/2 months later or by the end of the limitation year), covers regular or extra hours and would have been paid if employment had continued.

fields.name: Post Severance Compensation
Post Year End Compensation
Other Adjustments:
Describe any other adjustments
For Matching Contributions
Pay earned before participation
Amounts contributed pursuant to a salary reduction which are not includable in gross income under Code sections 125, 402(e)(3), 402(h), 403(b), 132(f), or 457
Certain fringe benefits
Differential military pay
Final Paycheck Pay
fields.desc: Excludes Final Paycheck Pay from Plan Compensation even though it is part of Statutory Compensation. This payment, made after severance (2-1/2 months later or by the end of the limitation year), reflects regular or additional compensation that would have been paid if employment had continued.

fields.name: Post Severance Compensation
Post Year End Compensation
Other Adjustments:
Describe any other adjustments
For Non-Elective Contributions
Pay earned before participation
Amounts contributed pursuant to a salary reduction which are not includable in gross income under Code sections 125, 402(e)(3), 402(h), 403(b), 132(f), or 457
Certain fringe benefits
Differential military pay
Final Paycheck Pay
fields.desc: Excludes Final Paycheck Pay from Plan Compensation despite its inclusion in Statutory Compensation. This payment is made after severance (2-1/2 months later or by the end of the limitation year) under conditions similar to those described for Elective and Matching contributions.

fields.name: Post Severance Compensation
Post Year End Compensation
Other Adjustments:
Describe any other adjustments
Plan Compensation is determined over the period specified below ending with or within the Plan Year
fields.desc: Specifies the period used for determining Plan Compensation; for SIMPLE 401(k) Plans, the period must be the calendar year.

fields.name: Other consecutive 12-month period (ex. April 1 through March 31)

title: A - General Information : Highly Compensated Employee

fields.name: Use top-paid group election in determining Highly Compensated Employees
Use calendar year beginning with or within the preceding Plan Year in determining Highly Compensated Employees
fields.desc: This option is not applicable if A.5a is set to 12/31.

title: A - General Information : Definition of Disability

fields.name: Definition of Disability
fields.desc: Specifies the required disability definition for distributions. If the chosen definition falls short of Code section 22(e) criteria, a stricter standard—requiring proof of a long-term, medically verified inability to work—will apply to deferrals, safe harbor contributions, QNECs, and QMACs. This language is incorporated in the SPD.

fields.name: If "other", describe definition of Disability (must be objectively determinable and may not be specified in a manner that is subject to Employer discretion)
fields.desc: Provide an objective definition for disability, such as a Plan Administrator’s finding that a Participant’s physical impairment prevents engagement in their current occupation.

fields.name: Name of state or commonwealth for choice of law
fields.desc: Enter the full state or commonwealth name (e.g., Wisconsin) for the choice of law, not the postal abbreviation.

title: B - Eligibility : Exclusions

fields.name: Exclude Employees covered under a collective bargaining agreement from definition of Eligible Employee
fields.desc: Excludes employees covered by a union contract where retirement benefits were negotiated and are not provided in the plan.

fields.name: For purposes of Elective Deferrals and Voluntary Contributions
fields.desc: Apply the union exclusion for Elective Deferrals and Voluntary Contributions; the same exclusion applies for safe harbor contributions.

fields.name: For purposes of Employer Matching Contributions
fields.desc: Apply the union exclusion for Employer Matching Contributions.

fields.name: For purposes of Non-Elective Contributions
fields.desc: Apply the union exclusion for Non-Elective Contributions.

fields.name: Exclude leased Employees from definition of Eligible Employee
fields.desc: Excludes leased employees defined as non-employees performing services under a leasing agreement, with exceptions if they are covered by a qualifying pension plan and do not exceed 20% of the non-highly compensated workforce.

fields.name: For purposes of Elective Deferrals and Voluntary Contributions
fields.desc: Apply the leased employee exclusion for Elective Deferrals and Voluntary Contributions; this exclusion also applies to safe harbor contributions.

fields.name: For purposes of Employer Matching Contributions
fields.desc: Apply the leased employee exclusion for Employer Matching Contributions.

fields.name: For purposes of Non-Elective Contributions
fields.desc: Apply the leased employee exclusion for Non-Elective Contributions.

fields.name: Exclude nonresident aliens from definition of Eligible Employee
fields.desc: Excludes nonresident aliens who have not earned income from services performed in the United States.

fields.name: For purposes of Elective Deferrals and Voluntary Contributions
fields.desc: Apply the nonresident alien exclusion for Elective Deferrals and Voluntary Contributions; the same exclusion applies for safe harbor contributions.

fields.name: For purposes of Employer Matching Contributions
fields.desc: Apply the nonresident alien exclusion for Employer Matching Contributions.

fields.name: For purposes of Non-Elective Contributions
fields.desc: Apply the nonresident alien exclusion for Non-Elective Contributions.

fields.name: Exclude other Employees from definition of Eligible Employee (cannot be based on age or length of service or create an indirect service requirement)
fields.desc: Excludes other specified employees from eligibility, although they must be counted for coverage testing unless statutorily excluded.

fields.name: Describe other excluded Employees
fields.desc: Provide an objective definition for additional excluded employees (e.g., 'Dental hygienists') without using age, service length, or subjective criteria. These employees are still counted in coverage testing.

fields.name: For purposes of Elective Deferrals and Voluntary Contributions
fields.desc: Apply the exclusion for Other Employees for Elective Deferrals and Voluntary Contributions using an objective definition.

fields.name: For purposes of Employer Matching Contributions
fields.desc: Apply the exclusion for Other Employees for Employer Matching Contributions using an objective definition.

fields.name: For purposes of Non-Elective Contributions
fields.desc: Apply the exclusion for Other Employees for Non-Elective Contributions using an objective definition.

fields.name: An Employee may irrevocably elect not to participate in the Plan
fields.desc: Allows employees to irrevocably opt out of the plan if the election is made before they become eligible; once eligible, opting out is not permitted. It may be preferable to exclude certain employees by job title due to strict ERISA waiver rules.

title: B - Eligibility : Eligibility Service Rules

fields.name: Count Years of service with other non-affiliated employers for eligibility purposes
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' to include years of service from non-affiliated employers (e.g., after an acquisition) for eligibility. Note that service with affiliated or predecessor employers is always counted, and vesting service is addressed separately under Section E (Treas. Reg. 1.401(a)(4)-5(a)(3)).

fields.name: List other non-affiliated employers and indicate for what purposes (e.g., Elective Deferrals, Employer Matching, etc.) the service applies
fields.desc: Provide details for each non-affiliated employer to credit eligibility service by listing the employer name, the applicable plan feature, any maximum service years, and the effective date. For example, if ABC Co. acquired on July 1, 2022 should count for Elective Deferrals for up to 3 years, list these details accordingly.

title: B - Eligibility : Break in Service

fields.name: Rule of parity.If an Employee does not have any nonforfeitable right to Employer contributions, exclude eligibility service before a period of five (5) consecutive One-Year Breaks in Service/Periods of Severance
fields.desc: Excludes prior service if an employee with 0% vesting experiences five consecutive one-year breaks in service, requiring new service to qualify again.

fields.name: One-year holdout.If an Employee has a One-Year Break in Service/Period of Severance, exclude eligibility service before such period until the Employee has completed a Year of Eligibility Service after returning to employment with the Employer
fields.desc: Excludes service before a one-year break until one full year of service is completed after rehire, applicable only to Non-Elective and Matching Contributions.

fields.name: Include Modifications to Rule of Parity and One-Year Holdout
fields.desc: Allows for modifications to the standard break in service rules, such as reducing the required service hours or limiting the rules to certain contributions.

fields.name: Describe the modifications that shall be made to the requirements specified above
fields.desc: Provide details on the modifications, for example setting a service hour threshold or specifying that the rule applies only to particular types of contributions.

title: B - Eligibility : Special Participation Date

fields.name: Allow immediate participation for all Eligible Employees employed on a particular date
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' to allow a special participation date so that, for instance, employees from an acquired company can join the plan immediately instead of waiting for the standard entry date.

fields.name: The special participation rule shall apply to all Eligible Employees employed on (mm/dd/yyyy)
fields.desc: Specify the exact hire or acquisition date that triggers the special participation rule for eligible employees, using the date format as set in the Global Document Print Settings.

fields.name: The Eligible Employees employed on the date specified above shall become eligible to participate in the Plan as of (mm/dd/yyyy)
fields.desc: Provide the effective entry date for eligible employees based on the special hire/acquisition date, indicating when they can start participating in the plan.

fields.name: The Plan does provide conditions or limitations on immediate participation
fields.desc: Describe any specific conditions or limitations that apply to immediate participation, and clarify which plan contributions (e.g., Elective Deferrals, Employer Matching) are affected.

fields.name: Describe the conditions or limitations and indicate for what purposes they apply (must be objectively determinable and may not be specified in a manner that is subject to Employer discretion)
fields.desc: Provide a clear, objective description of the conditions or limitations for immediate participation, including the specific contributions to which these rules apply.

title: B - Eligibility : Age Requirement for Plan Participation

fields.name: Minimum age requirement for Elective Deferrals/Voluntary Contributions (enter "None" if no age requirement) (age 21 maximum; age 26 maximum applies for certain educational institution plans)
fields.desc: Sets the minimum age for Elective Deferrals/Voluntary Contributions. Enter 'None' if no age limit applies. Maximum allowed is age 21, or age 26 for eligible educational institution plans.

fields.name: Minimum age requirement for Employer Matching Contributions (enter "None" if no age requirement) (age 21 maximum; age 26 maximum applies for certain educational institution plans)
fields.desc: Sets the minimum age for Employer Matching Contributions. Use 'None' if not applicable. The maximum is age 21, except when a plan qualifies as an educational institution plan, then age 26 applies.

fields.name: Minimum age requirement for Non-Elective Contributions (enter "None" if no age requirement) (age 21 maximum; age 26 maximum applies for certain educational institution plans)
fields.desc: Specifies the minimum age for Non-Elective Contributions. Enter 'None' if there is no age requirement. Maximum age is 21, or 26 for qualifying educational institution plans.

title: B - Eligibility : Service Requirement for Plan Participation

fields.name: Elective Deferrals/Voluntary Contributions- minimum service requirement
fields.desc: Specifies the minimum service requirement for Elective Deferrals/Voluntary Contributions. Options include: None; One Year (by Hours of Service or Elapsed Time); Specified Hours or Months (with a maximum of 1000 hours); and an 'Other' option. A failsafe applies if 1000 hours are completed during the Eligibility Computation Period.

fields.name: Enter the Hours of Service that must be completed in the period described above (without commas)
fields.desc: Enter the required number of Hours of Service (up to 1000) needed to meet the service requirement.

fields.name: Enter the number of months as specified above
fields.desc: Enter the required number of months that must be completed for the service requirement.

fields.name: Describe minimum service requirement if "Other" is selected
fields.desc: Provide a detailed description of the alternative service requirement, ensuring it complies with Code section 410(a) and is objectively determinable.

fields.name: In addition to the foregoing, the Plan provides for additional requirements for eligibility to make Elective Deferrals/Voluntary Contributions
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if there are additional, objectively determinable eligibility requirements for Elective Deferrals/Voluntary Contributions beyond the standard service requirement.

fields.name: Describe the other eligibility requirements
fields.desc: Provide details on any other eligibility conditions imposed for Elective Deferrals/Voluntary Contributions.

fields.name: Employer Matching Contributions- minimum service requirement
fields.desc: Specifies the minimum service requirement for Employer Matching Contributions. Options mirror those for Elective Deferrals, including None, One Year (by Hours or Elapsed Time), Specified Hours/Months, and an 'Other' option, with a failsafe if 1000 hours are reached.

fields.name: Enter the Hours of Service that must be completed in the period described above (without commas)
fields.desc: Enter the required number of Hours of Service (up to 1000) for meeting the service requirement for Matching Contributions.

fields.name: Enter the number of Months as specified above
fields.desc: Enter the required number of months that must be completed for the service requirement for Matching Contributions.

fields.name: Describe minimum service requirement if "Other" is selected
fields.desc: Provide a description of the alternative service requirement for Matching Contributions if 'Other' is chosen.

fields.name: In addition to the foregoing, the Plan provides for additional requirements for eligibility to receive allocations of Employer Matching Contributions
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if additional, objectively determinable eligibility requirements exist for receiving Employer Matching Contributions.

fields.name: Describe the other eligibility requirements
fields.desc: Detail any additional eligibility conditions for Employer Matching Contributions that are imposed by the plan.

fields.name: Non-Elective Contributions- minimum service requirement
fields.desc: Specifies the minimum service requirement for Non-Elective Contributions. Options are similar to those for Matching Contributions, with a failsafe if 1000 hours are completed during the Eligibility Computation Period.

fields.name: Enter the Hours of Service that must be completed in the period described above (without commas)
fields.desc: Enter the required number of Hours of Service (up to 1000) for Non-Elective Contributions eligibility.

fields.name: Enter the number of months as specified above
fields.desc: Enter the required number of months that must be completed for Non-Elective Contributions eligibility.

fields.name: Describe minimum service requirement if "Other" is selected
In addition to the foregoing, the Plan provides for additional requirements for eligibility to receive allocations of Non-Elective Contributions
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if there are additional, objectively determinable eligibility requirements for receiving Non-Elective Contributions.

fields.name: Describe the other eligibility requirements
fields.desc: Provide details on any other additional eligibility requirements for Non-Elective Contributions.

fields.name: For any contribution type above, if minimum service requirements are not met in the first consecutive month period, indicate the next service requirement
fields.desc: Specifies the alternative service requirement if the initial period's requirement is not met. Options include rolling computation periods or reverting to the standard One Year - Hours of Service requirement.

fields.name: If "Revert" is selected, indicate the Hours of Service (not to exceed 1,000) needed
fields.desc: Enter the number of Hours of Service (up to 1000) required if the service requirement reverts after the first computation period.

title: B - Eligibility : Entry Dates

fields.name: Frequency of entry dates for Elective Deferrals/Voluntary Contributions (see Help Text for Note on entry date limitations)
fields.desc: Specifies that an eligible employee must begin participation by the earlier of the first day of the Plan Year following eligibility or 6 months after meeting eligibility, with adjustments for 'First day of the Plan Year' (reduced age/service requirements) or 'Immediate' entry.

fields.name: If "other dates", describe other entry dates (include timing rules as applicable - coincident with or next following, for example)
fields.desc: Provide details for alternative entry date timing, for example, starting on the first day of the pay period that coincides with or immediately follows eligibility.

fields.name: Timing of entry date
Frequency of entry dates for Employer Matching Contributions (see Help Text for Note on entry date limitations)
fields.desc: Specifies that an eligible employee must begin receiving matching contributions by the earlier of the first day of the Plan Year after eligibility or 6 months later, with similar adjustments for 'First day of the Plan Year' or 'Immediate' options.

fields.name: If "other dates", describe other entry dates (include timing rules as applicable - coincident with or next following, for example)
fields.desc: Provide alternative timing details for entry dates, such as aligning with the start of the pay period.

fields.name: Timing of entry date
fields.desc: Allows the entry date for matching contributions to occur before the service requirement is fully met, with retroactive credit once the required service is completed.

fields.name: Frequency of entry dates for Non-Elective Contributions (see Help Text for Note on entry date limitations)
fields.desc: Requires eligible employees to start receiving non-elective contributions by the earlier of the first day of the Plan Year after eligibility or 6 months later, with modified requirements if 'First day of the Plan Year' or 'Immediate' options are selected.

fields.name: If "other dates", describe other entry dates (include timing rules as applicable - coincident with or next following, for example)
fields.desc: Provide details for alternative entry dates, such as beginning on the first day of the pay period that coincides with or follows eligibility.

fields.name: Timing of entry date
fields.desc: Specifies that non-elective contributions can be awarded retroactively to the first day of the current Plan Year once the eligibility requirements are met.

title: B - Eligibility : Eligibility Service Computation Rules (Hours of Service Only)

fields.name: Eligibility Computation Period switch to Plan Year
fields.desc: Indicate 'Yes' if the eligibility period will switch to a Plan Year when age/service requirements are not met within the initial 12-month period from hire.

fields.name: Select hours equivalency for eligibility purposes
fields.desc: Choose the conversion or equivalency factor that translates Hours of Service into eligibility service credits.

fields.name: The equivalency selected shall apply to the following employees
fields.desc: Specify which groups of employees the selected hours equivalency will apply to.

fields.name: Modifications shall be made to the above (switch to plan year and/or hours equivalency)
fields.desc: Indicate if any modifications to the standard switch to Plan Year or hours equivalency rules are applied, ensuring these modifications are objective.

fields.name: Enter any modifications to the above (switch to plan year and/or hours equivalency)
fields.desc: Provide details of the modifications, such as restrictions on accounts where the Plan Year switch applies, ensuring they are objectively determinable.

title: C - Contributions - Elective Deferrals : Elective Deferrals

fields.name: The Plan will impose minimum or maximum amounts on Elective Deferrals (other than those imposed by Code Section 415)
fields.desc: Indicate whether the plan sets minimum and/or maximum limits on elective deferrals, excluding limits imposed by Code Section 415.

fields.name: The Plan will impose a minimum contribution requirement (if safe harbor match is selected, may not be used to limit deferrals by NHCEs)
fields.desc: Specify if a minimum contribution requirement is applied to elective deferrals. Note: For safe harbor match plans, this requirement cannot limit deferrals by non-highly compensated employees.

fields.name: Minimum Elective Deferral contribution
fields.desc: Enter the minimum elective deferral contribution amount.

fields.name: Enter the percentage or dollar amount without $ or %
fields.desc: Provide the minimum contribution as a percentage or a dollar amount, without using the $ or % symbols.

fields.name: The Plan will impose a maximum deferral (if safe harbor match is selected, may not be used to prevent NHCEs from receiving the full match)
fields.desc: Specify if a maximum deferral limit is imposed. Up to 100% is allowed by law, though a limit of around 80% may be considered for tax reasons. For safe harbor match plans, the limit must not restrict non-highly compensated employees from receiving the full match, and SIMPLE 401(k) plans require a 100% maximum.

fields.name: Maximum Elective Deferral contribution
fields.desc: Enter the maximum elective deferral contribution amount.

fields.name: Enter the percentage or dollar amount without $ or %
fields.desc: Provide the maximum contribution as a percentage or a dollar amount, without using the $ or % symbols.

fields.name: There are other limitations on Elective Deferrals
fields.desc: Specify any additional limitations on elective deferrals. Note: For safe harbor or QACA match plans, such limitations must not restrict NHCEs and must be objectively determinable.

fields.name: Describe the other limitations on Elective Deferrals (must be objectively determinable and may not be specified in a manner that is subject to Employer discretion)
fields.desc: Provide a clear, objective description of any additional limitations on elective deferrals, ensuring they are not subject to employer discretion and do not limit NHCEs if safe harbor or QACA match applies.

fields.name: Participants modify/start/stop elections regarding Elective Deferrals/Voluntary Contributions
fields.desc: Indicate how participants may modify, start, or stop their elections. If 'Pursuant to Plan Administrator procedures' is selected, a written policy must be established.

fields.name: Participants may stop an election to contribute at any time
fields.desc: Specify whether participants can stop their elective deferral election at any time or only during designated periods for regular election changes.

fields.name: Allow Participants to make Catch-up Contributions
fields.desc: Indicate whether participants are permitted to make catch-up contributions.

title: C - Contributions - Elective Deferrals : Automatic Enrollment Provisions

fields.name: The Plan has Automatic Enrollment provisions intended to satisfy
fields.desc: Indicate if the plan’s automatic enrollment provisions are designed to satisfy enrollment requirements. If QACA provisions are met, the corresponding EACA provisions will also be available.

fields.name: If the plan is intended to satisfy only ACA requirements, will the automatic enrollment provisions be set according to a written administrative policy
fields.desc: Specify whether, for plans meeting only ACA requirements, automatic enrollment is governed by a formal written administrative policy.

fields.name: Indicate which employees will be subject to the automatic enrollment provisions of the Plan:
fields.desc: Select which group of employees automatic enrollment applies to. Options include: only participants whose entry date is on or after a specified date; all participants without an existing affirmative election; all participants (including those with a low affirmative election); or a custom, objectively defined subset.

fields.name: Indicate the Plan entry date after which automatic enrollment provisions will apply:
fields.desc: Enter the specific plan entry date from which the automatic enrollment provisions will take effect.

fields.name: If "Other" is selected, describe the application of the Plan's automatic enrollment provisions to current and future Plan participants:
fields.desc: Provide a clear, objective description of how automatic enrollment applies to current and future participants when 'Other' is selected.

fields.name: For an EACA Plan, indicate which employees will be "covered employees" who are subject to the automatic contribution arrangement:
fields.desc: Specify which employees are 'covered' by the automatic contribution arrangement. Options include: all eligible employees (allowing the extended 6-month correction period and reapplication only when affirmative elections expire) or only those with no existing affirmative election, which limits the use of the correction period.

title: C - Contributions - Elective Deferrals : Automatic Enrollment - ACA and EACA

fields.name: Amount of initial automatic enrollment election (as a % of pay):
fields.desc: If EACA is selected, the initial default contribution must be a uniform percentage of Plan Compensation, though it may vary by years of service.

fields.name: The amount specified above will increase
fields.desc: Indicate whether the initial automatic enrollment percentage will increase over time.

fields.name: If the automatic enrollment percentage will increase, provide the percentage by which deferrals will increase:
fields.desc: Specify the incremental increase percentage for deferrals (e.g., a 1% increase, up to a maximum defined in 7b.ii).

fields.name: If the Plan utilizes auto-increase, indicate the highest percentage to which the auto-increase provisions will apply.
fields.desc: Enter the maximum auto-increase percentage that the deferral election can reach.

fields.name: The plan should delay automatic enrollment
fields.desc: Indicate if the plan delays the start of automatic enrollment.

fields.name: Specify the period after which automatic enrollment shall begin
fields.desc: Provide the delay period after which automatic enrollment starts.

title: C - Contributions - Elective Deferrals : Automatic Enrollment - QACA Safe Harbor

fields.name: Enter the amount of the election for the initial period as percentage of Compensation (3 -> 10)
fields.desc: Sets the initial automatic enrollment percentage (between 3% and 10%) for QACA plans; must work in tandem with C.8 and C.9 to meet minimum requirements.

fields.name: Enter the amount of the election for the first year after the initial period as a percentage of Compensation (4 -> 15)
fields.desc: Specifies the enrollment percentage for the first year after the initial period, ranging from 4% to 15%.

fields.name: Enter the amount of the election for the second year after the initial period as a percentage of Compensation (5 -> 15)
fields.desc: Specifies the enrollment percentage for the second year after the initial period, ranging from 5% to 15%.

fields.name: Enter the amount of the election for the third year after the initial period as a percentage of Compensation (6 -> 15)
fields.desc: Specifies the enrollment percentage for the third year after the initial period, ranging from 6% to 15%.

fields.name: Election increases after the third year
fields.desc: Indicate if the automatic enrollment percentage will continue to increase annually beyond the third year if it has not yet reached 15%.

fields.name: Enter the amount/manner of the election increases after the third year (must be at least 6%)
fields.desc: Describe the schedule and incremental increase (minimum 6%) after the third year until the maximum of 15% is reached.

title: C - Contributions - Elective Deferrals : Application of Increase Provisions

fields.name: The first deferral rate increase will occur on:
fields.desc: Sets the timing for the first deferral increase. For example, if 'First day of the second Plan Year' is chosen with an initial deferral on May 1, 2022, the increase would occur on January 1, 2024. For QACA plans, the increase cannot be delayed beyond the first day of the second Plan Year after automatic enrollment becomes effective, and must comply with the minimum requirements in C.8 and C.9.

fields.name: If "First day of the __ Plan Year" is selected, indicate which Plan Year will be used (e.g., "second" or "third")
fields.desc: Specify the Plan Year (such as 'second' or 'third') that will trigger the first deferral rate increase when using the 'First day of the __ Plan Year' option.

fields.name: If "Other" is selected, describe when the first deferral rate increase will occur:
fields.desc: Describe the alternative timing for the first deferral increase (e.g., specifying a particular date like March 15th) if the 'Other' option is selected.

fields.name: Subsequent deferral elections increases will occur on:
fields.desc: Indicate the schedule for subsequent deferral rate increases. Note that the 'Other' option cannot be used if the plan is intended to satisfy EACA or QACA requirements.

fields.name: If "Other" is selected, indicate when subsequent deferral election increases will occur:
fields.desc: Provide the specific timing details for subsequent increases if the 'Other' option is chosen.

title: C - Contributions - Elective Deferrals : Permissible Withdrawals (EACA/QACA)

fields.name: Permissible withdrawals are allowed under the plan
fields.desc: Indicate whether the plan permits permissible withdrawals under the EACA/QACA rules.

fields.name: Enter time period to request a permissible withdrawal (no fewer than 30 or more than 90 days)
fields.desc: Specify the withdrawal request period—between 30 and 90 days—using 'days' or 'months' (e.g., '60 days' or '1 month') without additional punctuation.

title: C - Contributions - Elective Deferrals : Automatic Enrollment - Contribution Type

fields.name: If Roth contributions are allowed to the Plan, select whether automatic contributions will be pre-tax or Roth
fields.desc: Specify whether automatic contributions will be pre-tax or Roth; this option applies only if the plan permits Roth contributions (A.8b is 'Yes').

title: C - Contributions - Elective Deferrals : Voluntary Contributions

fields.name: If Voluntary Contribution are allowed, Minimum Voluntary Contribution (enter "None" if no Minimum)
fields.desc: Specify the minimum voluntary contribution allowed. Enter 'None' if there is no minimum. This applies only if voluntary contributions are permitted and the employee is eligible.

fields.name: Maximum Voluntary Contribution (enter "100%" if no Maximum)
fields.desc: Define the maximum voluntary contribution allowed. Use '100%' if there is no maximum limit, applicable only for eligible employees.

fields.name: Maximum of total combined Elective Deferral/Voluntary Contribution (enter "100%" if no Minimum or Maximum)
fields.desc: Set the overall cap on combined elective deferrals and voluntary contributions. Enter '100%' if there are no limits.

fields.name: Other Maximum or Minimum Voluntary Contribution (enter "None" or "N/A" if not applicable)
fields.desc: Specify any additional limits on voluntary contributions. Enter 'None' or 'N/A' if not applicable. These limits must be nondiscriminatory and objectively determinable.

title: C - Contributions - Elective Deferrals : Safe Harbor Contributions

fields.name: This is a safe harbor plan exempt from most testing
fields.desc: Indicate if the plan is a safe harbor plan and select the applicable safe harbor option: safe harbor match, nonelective contribution, nonelective contribution with follow-up notice, QACA safe harbor match, QACA nonelective contribution, or QACA nonelective contribution with follow-up notice. (Note: SIMPLE 401(k) Plans cannot be safe harbor.)

fields.name: Indicate Minimum % Compensation (without %)
fields.desc: Enter the minimum percentage of compensation required for safe harbor contributions, without including the % symbol.

fields.name: Indicate the safe harbors the Plan is intended to satisfy
fields.desc: Select the safe harbor tests the plan will satisfy, such as ADP/ACP, ADP/ACP - QACA, ADP only, or ADP only - QACA, based on the corresponding Code sections.

fields.name: Include special effective date for safe harbor provisions
fields.desc: Enter the effective date for safe harbor provisions, ensuring it complies with IRS guidance. Typically, the date must be the first day of the Plan Year (with specific exceptions for new plans or when adding arrangements).

fields.name: Enter effective date of safe harbor provisions
fields.desc: Provide the effective date for the safe harbor provisions.

fields.name: Safe harbor contributions will be made to another plan
fields.desc: Indicate if safe harbor contributions are to be allocated to a different plan.

fields.name: Name other plan which safe harbor contributions are made
fields.desc: Specify the name of the other plan receiving safe harbor contributions. The other plan must use the same Plan Year as this plan.

fields.name: The Plan may contain safe harbor contributions pursuant to prior safe harbor provisions
fields.desc: Indicate whether the plan includes safe harbor contributions under previous safe harbor provisions.

fields.name: Provide details about prior safe harbor provisions or contribution types:
fields.desc: Describe the details of any prior safe harbor provisions or the types of contributions that were made under those provisions.

title: C - Contributions - Elective Deferrals : ADP/ACP Safe Harbor Eligibility

fields.name: Safe harbor contribution exclusions from definition of Eligible Employee
fields.desc: Specify any additional exclusions for safe harbor eligibility. Enter 'None' if all participants are eligible. Note that exclusions in Section B still apply, and if 'Highly Compensated Employees' is selected, the employer may optionally contribute to HCEs at a rate not exceeding that for non-highly compensated employees.

fields.name: Describe other exclusions from definition of Eligible Employee (in addition to the exclusions under Section B)

For purposes of safe harbor contributions, Participants covered by a collective bargaining agreement will share in safe harbor allocations provided retirement benefits were the subject of good faith bargaining
fields.desc: Indicate whether employees covered by a collective bargaining agreement, where retirement benefits were bargained in good faith, will participate in safe harbor contributions. If not selected, these employees will be excluded from receiving safe harbor allocations.

fields.name: Service requirement for safe harbor eligibility
fields.desc: Specify the service (and age) requirements for safe harbor eligibility. If the requirements are stricter than those for elective deferrals, testing and disaggregation will be required.

fields.name: If "Same as", indicate which eligibility requirements will be used
If safe harbor has other age and service requirements, describe the requirements (include entry date(s) and definition of year of service, if applicable)
fields.desc: Provide the specific age and service requirements for safe harbor eligibility (up to age 21 and one year of service, defined as 1,000 hours). Include the applicable entry dates and the definition for a 'Year of Eligibility Service'. Note that ADP/ACP testing is required for participants who have not met these safe harbor thresholds.

fields.name: Require service for eligible Highly Compensated Employees to receive safe harbor contribution
fields.desc: Indicate whether Highly Compensated Employees must meet an additional service requirement to receive safe harbor nonelective contributions. Select 'Yes' if required; select 'No' if all employees are eligible regardless of hours worked.

fields.name: Number of hours required (1000 maximum without commas)
Require employment on last day of Plan Year for Highly Compensated Employees to receive safe harbor contribution
Employer contributions will be offset by safe harbor contributions
fields.desc: Specify whether employer contributions under Section D are offset by the safe harbor non-elective contribution. Select 'Yes' to offset additional contributions beyond the safe harbor amount; select 'No' to provide full employer contributions in addition to the safe harbor allocation.

fields.name: Pay earned before participation is included in Plan Compensation for Safe Harbor contributions
fields.desc: Indicate 'Yes' if pay earned before participation is to be included in the Plan Compensation calculation for safe harbor contributions, using the same definition as for elective deferrals/voluntary contributions.

title: C - Contributions - Elective Deferrals : Safe Harbor Matching Contributions

fields.name: Safe Harbor Matching Contribution formula
fields.desc: Choose the method for determining the safe harbor matching amount and its allocation. Options include single, two-rate, or three-rate formulas. The formula must ensure that no HCE receives a higher match rate than a NHCE, and it must meet the minimum requirements for traditional safe harbor or QACA match, with additional limitations if the plan also satisfies ACP safe harbor.

fields.name: First rate of Safe Harbor Matching Contributions (without % sign - percent of elective deferrals match)
fields.desc: Enter the first match rate as a percentage. This rate must meet the minimum safe harbor match requirements—100% of matched contributions up to a defined threshold and 50% on amounts above that threshold—according to whether the plan uses a traditional or QACA match, and must not increase with higher deferral levels.

fields.name: Maximum amount of Employee contributions matched (without % sign - maximum percent of compensation matched at rate above)
fields.desc: Specify the maximum percentage of Plan Compensation to which the first match rate applies. For example, a traditional safe harbor match typically applies to the first 3% of compensation, while a QACA match requires a rate between 3.5% and 6%.

fields.name: Second rate of Safe Harbor Matching Contributions (without % sign - percent of elective deferrals matched at second step)
fields.desc: Enter the second match rate for a two-rate formula. This rate applies to contributions above the first threshold and must adhere to the safe harbor rules, ensuring that HCEs do not receive a higher match rate than NHCEs and that the match rate does not increase with higher deferrals.

fields.name: Maximum amount of Employee contributions matched (without % sign - maximum percent of compensation matched at rate above)
fields.desc: Enter the maximum percentage of compensation that qualifies for the second match rate. This limit must comply with the safe harbor requirements, ensuring that the combined match does not exceed prescribed limits.

fields.name: Third rate of Safe Harbor Matching Contributions (without % sign - percent of elective deferrals matched at third step)
fields.desc: If using a three-rate formula, enter the third match rate as a percentage. This rate applies to the highest tier of contributions and must follow safe harbor rules similar to the first and second rates.

fields.name: Maximum amount of Employee contributions matched (without % sign - maximum percent of compensation matched at rate above)
fields.desc: Specify the maximum percentage of Plan Compensation subject to the third match rate. For example, this might be set at 6% of compensation, in accordance with safe harbor and ACP limitations.

fields.name: Safe Harbor Matching Contributions are determined at the following time(s):
fields.desc: Define the determination period for calculating safe harbor matching contributions. If contributions are funded more frequently than this period, a true-up is required to ensure that each participant receives the full matching amount based on their total deferrals and compensation over the entire period.

title: C - Contributions - Elective Deferrals : ADP Testing Elections

fields.name: Actual Deferral Ratios of Nonhighly Compensated Employees are determined using
fields.desc: Specify the basis for calculating the deferral ratios of NHCEs. For safe harbor years, select 'current year'.

fields.name: If "Prior year" and the Plan is a new 401(k) plan, designate NHCE percentage for first Plan Year
fields.desc: For new plans using 'Prior year' testing, provide the designated NHCE percentage for the first Plan Year.

title: C - Contributions - Elective Deferrals : ACP Testing Elections

fields.name: Actual Contribution Ratios of Nonhighly Compensated Employees are determined using
fields.desc: Select 'current year' when the plan is a 401(k) safe harbor plan that automatically meets the ACP Test requirements.

fields.name: If "Prior year" and the Plan is a new 401(k) plan, designate NHCE percentage for first Plan Year
fields.desc: For new plans using 'Prior year' testing, specify the designated NHCE percentage for the first Plan Year. Note that different testing methods for ADP and ACP are allowed, provided that recharacterizations, use of elective deferrals for ACP testing under Section 5.02(b), or qualified matching contributions for ADP testing under Section 5.02(a) are not permitted.

title: D - Contributions - Employer Matching : Employer Matching - Allocation Service

fields.name: In order to share in the allocation of Employer Matching Contributions, a Participant is required to complete Hours of Service in the applicable period
fields.desc: A participant must complete a specified number of service hours during the applicable period to qualify for matching contributions, unless the plan is a safe harbor 401(k) plan.

fields.name: Hours of Service required in the applicable period for a Participant to receive an allocation of Employer Matching Contributions (not to exceed 1,000 hours in a Plan Year or a prorated version thereof)
fields.desc: Enter the required number of service hours (up to 1,000 hours per plan year or a prorated equivalent) needed for eligibility.

fields.name: In order to share in the allocation of Employer Matching Contributions, a Participant is required to be employed by the Employer on the last day of the applicable period
fields.desc: The participant must be employed on the last day of the service period to receive matching contributions, except when the plan is a safe harbor 401(k) plan.

fields.name: In order to share in the allocation of Employer Matching Contributions, a Participant is required to be employed by the Employer on the last day of the applicable period or complete at least the Hours of Service specified below in the applicable period
fields.desc: Eligibility for matching contributions can be met either by being employed on the last day of the period or by completing the required number of service hours.

fields.name: Enter Hours of Service required (not to exceed 1,000 hours in a Plan Year or a prorated version thereof)
fields.desc: Specify the alternative required service hours (up to 1,000 hours per plan year, or a prorated version) for eligibility under this provision.

fields.name: The applicable period for determining the satisfaction of service requirements for an allocation of Employer Matching Contributions will be:
fields.desc: Define the period over which a participant's service is measured to determine eligibility for matching contributions.

fields.name: If "Other" is selected, describe the applicable period for determining the satisfaction of service requirements for an allocation of Employer Matching Contributions
fields.desc: Provide a detailed description of the custom service period used to assess whether a participant meets the service requirements when 'Other' is selected.

title: D - Contributions - Employer Matching : Employer Matching - Hours of Service Computation Rules and Exceptions

fields.name: If allocations depend on hours of service, select hours equivalency
fields.desc: Indicate the conversion factor used to translate hours of service when allocations depend on service, applicable if related rules (e.g., D.1c) are activated.

fields.name: The hours equivalency selected above shall apply to
fields.desc: Specify the group of employees to which the selected hours equivalency applies.

fields.name: Count hours of service with employers other than the Employer for purposes of satisfying the allocation service requirements
fields.desc: Indicate whether service hours worked for other employers will count toward meeting the allocation service requirements.

fields.name: If "Yes", list the other employer(s) and any limitations:
fields.desc: List the other employer(s) whose service hours count and describe any applicable limitations.

fields.name: If the Plan has a last day requirement, an Employee who terminates on the last day of the applicable period is treated as being employed for purposes of satisfying allocation conditions
fields.desc: State that employees terminating on the last day of the period are considered employed for allocation purposes.

fields.name: Modify Hour of Service requirement and/or last day requirement for a Participant who Terminates employment with the Employer during the Plan Year due to death
fields.desc: Specify modifications to service or last day requirements for participants who terminate due to death (applicable if prior service rules are in effect).

fields.name: Modify Hour of Service requirement and/or last day requirement for a Participant who Terminates employment with the Employer during the Plan Year due to Disability
fields.desc: Specify modifications to service or last day requirements for participants who terminate due to disability (applicable if prior service rules are in effect).

fields.name: Modify Hour of Service requirement and/or last day requirement for a Participant who Terminates employment with the Employer during the Plan Year due to attainment of Normal Retirement Date
fields.desc: Specify modifications to service or last day requirements for participants who terminate upon reaching normal retirement (applicable if prior service rules are in effect).

fields.name: Modify Hour of Service requirement and/or last day requirement for a Participant who Terminates employment with the Employer during the Plan Year due to attainment of Early Retirement date
fields.desc: Specify modifications to service or last day requirements for participants who terminate upon early retirement (applicable if prior service rules are in effect).

fields.name: Any Hour of Service requirement and last day requirement shall be modified upon the occurrence of the events described above as follows
fields.desc: Describe how the standard service and last day requirements are adjusted when the events in 5b–5e occur.

fields.name: Modifications shall be made to the service described above for an allocation of Employer Matching contributions
fields.desc: Detail any modifications to the service requirements for matching contributions, such as waiving the last day requirement for death or modifying requirements to accept pro rata hours for early termination.

fields.name: Describe the modifications
fields.desc: Provide a clear, objective description of the modifications to the service and last day requirements under the specified termination circumstances.

fields.name: Method to fix Employer Matching Contribution Code section 410(b) ratio percentage coverage failures
fields.desc: Select the corrective method for addressing coverage failures: through a corrective amendment per IRS regulations, by selectively making additional participants eligible, or by making all non-excludable participants eligible.

title: D - Contributions - Employer Matching : Matched Employee Contribution Inclusions

fields.name: The Employer will include a Participant's Catch-Up contributions in the definition of Matched Employee Contributions
fields.desc: Include catch-up contributions as part of the matched employee contributions. Note that non-catch-up pre-tax deferrals are always included, and if the plan meets ACP safe harbor, then all elective deferrals must be included.

fields.name: The Employer will include a Participant's Roth Deferrals in the definition of Matched Employee Contributions
fields.desc: Include Roth deferrals as part of the matched employee contributions. Pre-tax deferrals are always included, and for ACP safe harbor plans, all elective deferrals must be counted.

fields.name: The Employer will include a Participant's Voluntary Contributions in the definition of Matched Employee Contributions
fields.desc: Include voluntary contributions in the calculation of matched employee contributions.

title: D - Contributions - Employer Matching : Employer Matching Contribution Formula

fields.name: Employer Matching Contribution formula
fields.desc: Choose the method for calculating and allocating the employer's matching contribution. Options include discretionary, single rate, two rates, three rates, years of service, or a special schedule. The formula must meet nondiscrimination standards and, if ACP safe harbor applies, adhere to its limits.

fields.name: The discretionary amount will be allocated
fields.desc: For discretionary contributions, select the allocation method—either a uniform percentage or a flat dollar amount—or choose employer discretion with required written instructions and participant notice. This allocation must comply with nondiscrimination and ACP safe harbor requirements.

fields.name: First rate of Employer Matching Contributions (without % sign - percent of elective deferrals match)
fields.desc: Enter the first matching rate as a percentage of elective deferrals. For ACP safe harbor plans, this rate must not exceed safe harbor limits (e.g., contributions cannot exceed 6% of compensation, with no higher rate for HCEs).

fields.name: Maximum amount of Employee contributions matched (without % sign - maximum percent of compensation matched at rate above)
fields.desc: Specify the maximum percentage of compensation eligible for the first match rate, in line with ACP safe harbor restrictions.

fields.name: Second rate of Employer Matching Contributions (without % sign - percent of elective deferrals matched at second step)
fields.desc: Enter the second matching rate for deferrals above the first threshold, ensuring compliance with ACP safe harbor limits.

fields.name: Maximum amount of Employee contributions matched (without % sign - maximum percent of compensation matched at rate above)
fields.desc: Define the cap on the percentage of compensation that qualifies for the second matching rate, per ACP safe harbor rules.

fields.name: Third rate of Employer Matching Contributions (without % sign - percent of elective deferrals matched at third step)
fields.desc: If a three-rate formula is used, enter the third match rate for the highest tier of deferrals, subject to ACP safe harbor limitations.

fields.name: Maximum amount of Employee contributions matched (without % sign - maximum percent of compensation matched at rate above)
fields.desc: Specify the maximum percentage of compensation that applies to the third matching rate, in accordance with ACP safe harbor restrictions.

fields.name: Describe the special schedule that will determine the method of contribution/allocation for Employer Matching Contributions
fields.desc: Provide a detailed, objectively determinable description of the special schedule for matching contributions. This schedule should outline which formula or combination of formulas applies to different employee groups without employer discretion.

title: D - Contributions - Employer Matching : Additional Employer Matching Contributions

fields.name: Further discretionary Employer Matching Contributions may be made in addition to those described as first - third steps
fields.desc: Specify if additional discretionary matching contributions may be made beyond the initial tiers. If ACP safe harbor applies, such contributions must not exceed 6% of compensation, no HCE may receive a higher match than a NHCE, the match rate cannot increase with higher deferrals, and discretionary contributions are capped at 4% of compensation. Written instructions and participant notices are required.

fields.name: The further discretionary amount will be allocated
fields.desc: Select the allocation method for the additional discretionary matching contributions. Choose 'Uniform Percentage' or 'Flat Dollar' to avoid extra notice requirements, or 'At Employer Discretion' with the required written instructions. The allocation must meet nondiscrimination and, if applicable, ACP safe harbor limits.

fields.name: Further fixed Employer Matching Contributions will be made in addition to those described as first - third steps
fields.desc: Enter the fixed matching formula for additional contributions beyond the first three tiers. The formula must be objectively determinable and adhere to all applicable nondiscrimination rules.

fields.name: Describe any further tiered Employer Matching Contributions
fields.desc: Provide details of any additional tiered matching contributions. If ACP safe harbor applies, the additional tiers must also comply with safe harbor limits and nondiscrimination requirements.

title: D - Contributions - Employer Matching : Employer Matching Contribution Formula (Years of Service)

fields.name: Years of Service: describe years of service that applies to the first band
fields.desc: Specify the required years of service for participants to qualify for the first matching band.

fields.name: Years of Service: describe the matching percentage that applies to the first band (without % sign)
fields.desc: Enter the matching percentage for the first band as a numeric value (do not include the '%' symbol).

fields.name: Years of Service: describe years of service that applies to the second band
fields.desc: Specify the years of service required for participants to qualify for the second matching band.

fields.name: Years of Service: describe the matching percentage that applies to the second band (without % sign)
fields.desc: Enter the matching percentage for the second band as a numeric value (without the '%' symbol).

fields.name: Years of Service: describe years of service that applies to the third band
fields.desc: Define the required years of service for participants to qualify for the third matching band.

fields.name: Years of Service: describe the matching percentage that applies to the third band (without % sign)
fields.desc: Enter the matching percentage for the third band as a numeric value (omit the '%' sign).

fields.name: Years of Service: describe years of service that applies to the fourth band
fields.desc: Specify the years of service required for participants to qualify for the fourth matching band.

fields.name: Years of Service: describe the matching percentage that applies to the fourth band (without the % sign)
fields.desc: Enter the matching percentage for the fourth band as a numeric value (without using '%').

fields.name: Years of Service: cap that applies to all matched contributions
fields.desc: Indicate the maximum cap on years of service used in determining matched contributions.

fields.name: Years of Service: only Matched Contributions that are not in excess of the following percentage of the Participant's Compensation shall be matched
fields.desc: Enter the maximum percentage of a participant's compensation eligible for matching, as a numeric value without the '%' sign.

fields.name: Years of Service: describe the service to use
fields.desc: Specify the method used to determine the years of service for matching purposes.

fields.name: Years of Service: please enter the number of Hours of Service necessary to earn a year of service described above
fields.desc: Enter the number of service hours required to earn one year of service for matching contribution eligibility.

title: D - Contributions - Employer Matching : Employer Matching - Maximum Allocation

fields.name: Plan limits Employer Matching Contributions to a maximum amount/percentage in each Plan Year
fields.desc: Sets a cap on employer matching contributions per plan year. For ACP safe harbor plans with additional discretionary matching, the discretionary amount cannot exceed 4% of Plan Compensation. Discretionary matching limits (e.g., up to 6% of compensation) may be applied uniformly for all participants or for HCEs only; any 'Other' limit must be nondiscriminatory and objectively determinable.

fields.name: Enter the maximum percentage or dollar amount (without $ or % signs or commas)
fields.desc: Enter the maximum matching limit as a number, representing either a percentage or a dollar amount. For ACP safe harbor plans, discretionary matching is capped at 4% of compensation. This field allows setting limits (e.g., 6% of compensation) to avoid additional notice requirements; exceeding such limits may require a plan amendment.

fields.name: Enter the other maximum allocation for Employer Matching Contributions (include $ or %, as applicable)
fields.desc: Specify any additional maximum allocation for matching contributions. Include the appropriate unit (dollar or percentage) and ensure the limit is nondiscriminatory and objectively determinable.

fields.name: Apply the dollar limit above to the following period
fields.desc: Define the period over which the maximum dollar limit applies. This option is used only if a maximum dollar amount is set and the allocation period is not 'End of Plan Year.'

title: D - Contributions - Employer Matching : Employer Matching - Determination Period

fields.name: Employer Matching Contributions are determined at the following time(s)
fields.desc: Specifies the period used to determine matching contributions, which must be at least as long as the applicable service period. If contributions are funded more frequently (e.g., each pay period) than the determination period, a true-up is required to ensure participants receive their full match based on annual deferrals and compensation.

title: D - Contributions - Employer Matching : Non-Elective - Allocation Service

fields.name: Continuing Eligibility for Non-Elective Contributions
fields.desc: Indicate whether participants must maintain their eligibility status to continue receiving Non-Elective Contributions.

fields.name: In order to share in the allocation of Non-Elective Contributions, a Participant is required to complete Hours of Service in the applicable period
fields.desc: Specify if participants are required to complete a set number of service hours during the applicable period to qualify for Non-Elective Contributions.

fields.name: Hours of Service required in the applicable period for a Participant to receive an allocation of Non-Elective Contributions (not to exceed 1,000 hours in a Plan Year or a prorated version thereof)
fields.desc: Enter the number of service hours (up to 1,000 per plan year or prorated) that a participant must complete to be eligible for Non-Elective Contributions.

fields.name: In order to share in the allocation of Non-Elective Contributions, a Participant is required to be employed by the Employer on the last day of the applicable period
fields.desc: State whether participants must be employed on the last day of the applicable period to receive Non-Elective Contributions.

fields.name: In order to share in the allocation of Non-Elective Contributions, a Participant is required to be employed by the Employer on the last day of the applicable period or complete at least the Hours of Service specified below in the applicable period
fields.desc: Specify that eligibility for Non-Elective Contributions can be met either by being employed on the last day of the period or by completing the required service hours.

fields.name: Enter Hours of Service required (not to exceed 1,000 hours in a Plan Year or a prorated version thereof)
fields.desc: Provide the alternative required number of service hours (up to 1,000 per plan year or prorated) if the participant does not meet the last day employment requirement.

fields.name: The applicable period for determining the satisfaction of service requirements for an allocation of Non-Elective Contributions is:
fields.desc: Define the period over which a participant's service hours are measured for eligibility for Non-Elective Contributions.

fields.name: If "Other" describe the applicable period for determining the satisfaction of service requirements for an allocation of Non-Elective Contributions
fields.desc: Provide a detailed description of the custom service period used for determining Non-Elective Contributions eligibility if 'Other' is selected.

title: D - Contributions - Employer Matching : Non-Elective - Hours of Service Computation Rules and Exceptions

fields.name: If allocations depend on hours of service, select hours equivalency
fields.desc: Select the conversion factor to translate service hours when allocations depend on hours worked. (Applicable only if D.15a or D.15c is 'Yes'.)

fields.name: The hours equivalency selected above shall apply to
fields.desc: Specify the group of employees to whom the selected hours equivalency applies.

fields.name: Count hours of service with employers other than the Employer for purposes of satisfying the allocation service requirements
fields.desc: Indicate if service hours from other employers can be counted toward meeting the allocation service requirements.

fields.name: If "Yes", list the other employer(s) and any limitations:
fields.desc: Provide the names of other employers whose service hours count, along with any limitations.

fields.name: If the Plan has a last day requirement, an Employee who terminates on the last day of the applicable period is treated as being employed for purposes of satisfying allocation conditions
fields.desc: State that employees terminating on the last day of the applicable period are treated as still employed for allocation eligibility.

fields.name: Modify Hour of Service requirement and/or last day requirement for a Participant who Terminates employment with the Employer during the Plan Year due to death
fields.desc: Describe modifications to the service or last day requirements for participants who terminate due to death. (Applicable only if D.15a, D.15b, or D.15c is 'Yes'.)

fields.name: Modify Hour of Service requirement and/or last day requirement for a Participant who Terminates employment with the Employer during the Plan Year due to Disability
fields.desc: Specify the adjustments to service and/or last day requirements for participants who terminate due to disability. (Applicable only if D.15a, D.15b, or D.15c is 'Yes'.)

fields.name: Modify Hour of Service requirement and/or last day requirement for a Participant who Terminates employment with the Employer during the Plan Year due to attainment of Normal Retirement Date
fields.desc: Detail how the service or last day requirements are modified for participants who retire at the normal retirement age. (Applicable only if D.15a, D.15b, or D.15c is 'Yes'.)

fields.name: Modify Hour of Service requirement and/or last day requirement for a Participant who terminates employment with the Employer during the Plan Year due to attainment of Early Retirement date
fields.desc: Describe the modifications to the service or last day requirements for participants who retire early. (Applicable only if D.15a, D.15b, or D.15c is 'Yes'.)

fields.name: Any Hour of Service requirement and last day requirement shall be modified upon the occurrence of the events described above as follows
fields.desc: Specify how the standard service and last day requirements are adjusted when any of the termination events (death, disability, normal or early retirement) occur.

fields.name: Modifications shall be made to the service described above for an allocation of Non-Elective contributions
fields.desc: Describe any additional modifications to the service requirements for Non-Elective Contributions when termination events occur, ensuring these modifications are objectively determinable and not subject to employer discretion.

fields.name: Describe the modifications
fields.desc: Provide a detailed, objective description of the modifications to service requirements, such as waiving the last day requirement for death or accepting pro rata hours if a participant terminates before completing the full requirement.

fields.name: Method to fix Non-Elective Contribution Code section 410(b) ratio percentage coverage failures
fields.desc: Select the corrective method for addressing coverage failures: through a corrective amendment per IRS regulations, by selectively making additional participants eligible, or by making all non-excludable participants eligible.

title: D - Contributions - Employer Matching : Non-Elective - Amount

fields.name: Amount of Non-Elective Contributions
fields.desc: Specify the total amount allocated for Non-Elective Contributions.

fields.name: Enter percentage of Compensation or dollar amount (without percent sign, dollar sign, or commas)
fields.desc: Enter the contribution as a percentage of compensation or a fixed dollar amount using numeric values only. For example, enter "6" to denote 6% of Total Compensation, or "30000" to denote $30,000.

fields.name: Enter the other Non-Elective Contribution amount necessary to fund the provided allocation
fields.desc: Specify any additional contribution amount required for the allocation. For example, enter "5" to denote an additional 5% of the Employer's total profits for the Plan Year, or, for a SIMPLE Plan, state the amount needed to meet SIMPLE 401(k) Contribution requirements.

title: D - Contributions - Employer Matching : Non-Elective - Formula

fields.name: Non-Elective allocation formula
fields.desc: Select the method for allocating the Employer's Non-Elective Contribution. Options include: Pro rata (based on each participant's compensation relative to the total), Integrated (using a two-step or four-step method with limits on disparities), Points (allocating based on points for age, service, and compensation), Fixed Amount (equal division among eligible participants), Age Weighted (using age-based factors), and New Comparability formulas (either by defined groups or one group per participant). The chosen formula must be objectively determinable, nondiscriminatory, and, if 'Other fixed formula' is selected, must conform to one or a combination of these established methods.

fields.name: Define other fixed formula (must be objectively determinable and may not be specified in a manner that is subject to Employer discretion)
fields.desc: If 'Other fixed formula' is selected, provide a clear and objective description of the allocation method using one or a combination of the available options (e.g., pro rata for one group and fixed amount for another). This description must be nondiscriminatory and not subject to employer discretion.

title: D - Contributions - Employer Matching : Non-Elective - Integration

fields.name: The Plan will utilize the two-step method for allocating Non-Elective Contributions even when the Plan is Top-Heavy
fields.desc: Summarizes the integrated allocation method for Non-Elective Contributions. Option (1) uses a two-step method for non–Top-Heavy or adequately allocated plans, where contributions are first allocated based on the ratio of a participant’s combined Plan and Excess Compensation (subject to a disparity cap) and then any remainder is allocated based on Excess Compensation.
