Option (2) applies a four-step method for Top-Heavy plans that meet minimum requirements, where allocations are made sequentially: first based on Statutory Compensation (capped at 3%), second based on Excess Compensation (capped at 3%), third based on total compensation up to the disparity limit minus 3%, and finally any remainder is allocated on a pro rata basis.

fields.name: Integration level for determining Excess Compensation
fields.desc: Specify the integration level used to determine Excess Compensation. If 'Taxable wage base' is not selected, the permitted disparity is set according to the provided table.

fields.name: Enter fixed percentage or fixed dollar amount (without % or $)
fields.desc: Enter the integration level as either a fixed percentage (up to 100) or a fixed dollar amount, which must not exceed the taxable wage base in effect on the first day of the Plan Year.

title: D - Contributions - Employer Matching : Non-Elective - Points

fields.name: Points will be computed on basis of
fields.desc: Points are calculated based on a participant’s age, years of service (accrued after eligibility), and units of compensation earned during the Plan Year. The total points for each participant are compared to the total for all eligible participants, and if HCEs’ average allocation rate exceeds that of NHCEs, adjustments are made so that NHCEs receive a minimum level of points. The plan must be tested annually to ensure compliance with safe harbor requirements under Treas. Reg. 1.401(a)(4)-2(b)(3).

fields.name: Compensation to be used to calculate points award:
fields.desc: Specify which component of compensation (e.g., base, total, or another defined measure) will be used to calculate the points awarded for Non-Elective Contributions.

fields.name: Points to be awarded for Compensation
fields.desc: Enter the number of points assigned per unit of the specified compensation to determine the points award for each participant.

fields.name: Points awarded for each year of service
fields.desc: Indicate the number of points that will be awarded for each year of service accrued by the participant during the Plan Year, regardless of any service or last day requirements.

fields.name: Points awarded for each year of age
fields.desc: Enter the number of points awarded for each year of age attained by the participant during the Plan Year.

title: D - Contributions - Employer Matching : Non-Elective - Age Weighted Appendix

fields.name: Enter pre-retirement mortality assumption (appears in appendix)
fields.desc: Enter the pre-retirement mortality assumption used for age-weighted calculations. Points are determined by multiplying a participant’s Plan Compensation by a factor from Appendix A based on their age at the end of the Plan Year. Use a standard mortality table per Treas. Reg. 1.401(a)(4)-12 (e.g., GAM 71 Male, UP 1984, IAF 1983) for nondiscrimination testing.

fields.name: Enter post-retirement mortality assumption (appears in appendix)
fields.desc: Enter the post-retirement mortality assumption for age-weighted calculations. Points are computed as the product of Plan Compensation and the factor from Appendix A determined by age at year-end. A standard mortality table per Treas. Reg. 1.401(a)(4)-12 (e.g., GAM 71 Male, UP 1984, IAF 1983) must be used for testing nondiscrimination.

fields.name: Enter pre-retirement interest rate assumption (appears in appendix)
fields.desc: Enter the pre-retirement interest rate assumption for the age-weighted formula. Points are calculated by multiplying Plan Compensation by a factor from Appendix A based on the participant’s age as of the end of the Plan Year. A standard interest rate assumption per Treas. Reg. 1.401(a)(4)-12 must be used for nondiscrimination testing.

fields.name: Enter post-retirement interest rate assumption (appears in appendix)
fields.desc: Enter the post-retirement interest rate assumption for the age-weighted calculation. Points are determined as the product of Plan Compensation and a factor from Appendix A based on the participant’s age at year-end. Use a standard post-retirement interest rate assumption per Treas. Reg. 1.401(a)(4)-12 for testing purposes.

title: D - Contributions - Employer Matching : Non-Elective - New Comparability: Defined Groups

fields.name: New Comparability - Defined Groups: number of New Comparability groups (see Help Text for Note on parameters for defined groups)
fields.desc: Specify the number of clearly defined New Comparability groups. Groups must be defined objectively without bias toward selecting only low-compensation or short-service NHCEs. For self-employed individuals, Treas. Reg. 1.401(k)-1(a)(6) applies. Notify the Plan Administrator of each group’s allocated contributions; additional groups may be added via an Addendum.

fields.name: New Comparability - Defined Groups: members of Group One
fields.desc: Define the criteria for membership in Group One in an objective, nondiscriminatory manner and notify the allocated contribution amounts to the Plan Administrator.

fields.name: New Comparability - Defined Groups: Group One allocation method
fields.desc: Specify the allocation method for Group One (e.g., pro rata, fixed amount).

fields.name: New Comparability - Defined Groups: members of Group Two
fields.desc: Clearly define the membership criteria for Group Two in a manner that complies with nondiscrimination requirements and notify the Plan Administrator of the contributions allocated.

fields.name: New Comparability - Defined Groups: Group Two allocation method
fields.desc: Describe the allocation method for Group Two.

fields.name: New Comparability - Defined Groups: members of Group Three
fields.desc: Define the criteria for Group Three membership objectively and nondiscriminatorily; notify the allocated contribution amounts.

fields.name: New Comparability - Defined Groups: Group Three allocation method
fields.desc: Specify the allocation method for Group Three.

fields.name: New Comparability - Defined Groups: members of Group Four
fields.desc: Clearly define the membership for Group Four in a nondiscriminatory manner and notify the Plan Administrator of the allocated contributions.

fields.name: New Comparability - Defined Groups: Group Four allocation method
fields.desc: Specify the allocation method for Group Four.

fields.name: New Comparability - Defined Groups: members of Group Five
fields.desc: Define the membership criteria for Group Five objectively, ensuring compliance with nondiscrimination requirements, and notify the allocation amounts.

fields.name: New Comparability - Defined Groups: Group Five allocation method
fields.desc: Specify the allocation method for Group Five.

fields.name: New Comparability - Defined Groups: members of Group Six
fields.desc: Clearly define the membership criteria for Group Six in an objective manner and notify the allocated contributions; additional groups may be added via an Addendum.

fields.name: New Comparability - Defined Groups: Group Six allocation method
fields.desc: Specify the allocation method for Group Six.

fields.name: New Comparability - Defined Groups: members of Group Seven
fields.desc: Define Group Seven’s membership criteria clearly and objectively, ensuring that the group does not consist solely of the lowest-compensated NHCEs, and notify the contribution amounts.

fields.name: New Comparability - Defined Groups: Group Seven allocation method
fields.desc: Describe the allocation method for Group Seven.

fields.name: New Comparability - Defined Groups: members of Group Eight
fields.desc: Clearly define the membership criteria for Group Eight in a nondiscriminatory manner and notify the allocated contributions; additional groups may be specified in an Addendum.

fields.name: New Comparability - Defined Groups: Group Eight allocation method
fields.desc: Specify the allocation method for Group Eight.

fields.name: New Comparability - Defined Groups: members of Group Nine
fields.desc: Define the criteria for Group Nine membership clearly and objectively, ensuring that the group does not consist solely of NHCEs with the lowest compensation or shortest service, and notify the allocated contributions.

fields.name: New Comparability - Defined Groups: Group Nine allocation method
fields.desc: Specify the allocation method for Group Nine.

fields.name: New Comparability - Defined Groups: members of Group Ten
fields.desc: Clearly define the membership for Group Ten in an objective, nondiscriminatory manner and notify the Plan Administrator of the contributions allocated.

fields.name: New Comparability - Defined Groups: Group Ten allocation method
fields.desc: Describe the allocation method for Group Ten.

title: D - Contributions - Employer Matching : Non-Elective - Allocation Time and Max

fields.name: Non-Elective Contributions are determined at the following time(s)
fields.desc: Specify the determination period for Non-Elective Contributions. This period must be equal to or longer than the applicable period in D.16. Choosing any option other than 'End of Plan Year' may prevent the plan from meeting safe harbor allocation requirements.

fields.name: Non-Elective Contributions are subject to a minimum amount
fields.desc: Indicate whether a minimum contribution amount is applied to Non-Elective Contributions.

fields.name: Enter the minimum amount
fields.desc: Enter the minimum contribution amount as a percentage of compensation or a dollar amount (e.g., '3% of Compensation' or '100').

fields.name: Non-Elective Contributions are subject to a maximum amount
fields.desc: Indicate whether a maximum contribution limit is imposed on Non-Elective Contributions.

fields.name: Enter the maximum amount
fields.desc: Enter the maximum contribution amount as a percentage of compensation or a dollar amount (e.g., '7% of Compensation' or '1000').

title: D - Contributions - Employer Matching : Non-Elective - Disability

fields.name: Allocate Non-Elective Contributions to Disabled Participants (may include Disabled Participants who have Terminated Employment)
fields.desc: Enter 'Yes' if the plan continues to allocate Non-Elective Contributions to participants who become disabled (including those who have terminated employment) in subsequent plan years per Section 4.03(e). Enter 'No' if the plan only waives the service and last day requirements in the year the disability occurs.

fields.name: Select the anniversary of Disability when allocations end
fields.desc: Select the anniversary (from 1 to 10) of the disability start date on which Non-Elective Contribution allocations to a disabled participant will cease, unless an earlier end date is specified in Section 4.03(e) of the Basic Plan Document.

title: D - Contributions - Employer Matching : Non-Elective - Collectively Bargained Employees

fields.name: In addition to the amount selected in D.22, an amount necessary to satisfy the Employer's contribution requirements under an applicable collective bargaining agreement shall be allocated
fields.desc: Collectively bargained contributions are determined by the applicable collective bargaining agreement, so the rules in D.21-26 (amount, formula, timing, maximum, and minimum) do not apply.

fields.name: If "Yes", the amount shall be allocated as follows:
Collective bargaining allocations will offset any other Employer contributions that would otherwise be made to a Participant
fields.desc: Under the collective bargaining agreement, the allocation timing, maximums, and minimums for contributions are set independently, and these contributions will offset any other employer contributions.

fields.name: Describe the other offset

title: D - Contributions - Employer Matching : Non-Elective - Prevailing Wage

fields.name: Plan also provides for a prevailing wage allocation
fields.desc: Indicate that the plan includes a prevailing wage allocation component.

fields.name: The contribution allocated will be dependent on the Participant's job classification and the hourly rate established:
fields.desc: Specify how the contribution amount is determined based on job classifications and their established hourly rates. If 'in the Prevailing Wage Addendum' is selected, include the contribution amount so that both entries are populated.

fields.name: Describe the prevailing wage formula or job classification(s)/hourly rate(s), as applicable (see Help Text for additional information)
fields.desc: Provide the prevailing wage formula or list the job classifications and hourly rates used, as they will appear in the Prevailing Wage Addendum.

fields.name: Modifications will be made to the default prevailing wage contribution provisions:
fields.desc: Describe any modifications to the standard prevailing wage rules, which by default apply only to Nonhighly Compensated Employees, have no age/service or hours/last day requirements, and are 100% vested.

fields.name: Highly Compensated Employees will be eligible to receive prevailing wage contributions
fields.desc: Indicate whether Highly Compensated Employees are included for prevailing wage contributions.

fields.name: Age/service requirements apply in order to become eligible to receive prevailing wage contributions:
fields.desc: Specify if additional age or service requirements must be met for eligibility to receive prevailing wage contributions.

fields.name: Describe the age/service requirements that apply in order to become eligible to receive prevailing wage contributions:
fields.desc: Provide details on the specific age and service requirements for eligibility.

fields.name: A prevailing wage vesting schedule will apply:
fields.desc: Indicate if a vesting schedule is imposed on prevailing wage contributions.

fields.name: Describe the prevailing wage vesting schedule:
fields.desc: Describe the vesting schedule that will apply to prevailing wage contributions.

fields.name: Exclude certain Participants from receiving prevailing wage contributions
fields.desc: Indicate whether a nondiscriminatory class of employees will be excluded from receiving prevailing wage contributions.

fields.name: If "Yes", describe the Participants excluded from receiving prevailing wage contributions
fields.desc: Describe the criteria for excluding participants, ensuring the exclusion is nondiscriminatory.

fields.name: The prevailing wage allocation can offset other Employer Contributions
fields.desc: Specify that prevailing wage contributions may be used to offset other employer contributions, noting that such contributions are typically made quarterly.

fields.name: Employer Matching Contributions
fields.desc: Indicate that the offset applies to Employer Matching Contributions.

fields.name: Non-Elective Contributions
fields.desc: Indicate that the offset applies to Non-Elective Contributions.

fields.name: Safe Harbor Contributions
fields.desc: Indicate that the offset applies to Safe Harbor Contributions.

fields.name: Qualified Non-Elective Contributions (QNECs)/Qualified Matching Contributions (QMACs)
fields.desc: Indicate that the offset applies to QNECs and QMACs.

title: D - Contributions - Employer Matching : QNECs or QMACs

fields.name: Limitations, conditions or special rules apply to Qualified Non-Elective Contributions or Qualified Matching Contributions
fields.desc: Provide written instructions for discretionary QNECs or QMACs, detailing how the allocation is determined, the computation periods, and any separate rules by business location or classification. These instructions must be submitted by the contribution date, with a summary communicated to participants within 60 days of the last contribution.

fields.name: Describe limitations, conditions or special rules
fields.desc: Describe any additional limitations, conditions, or special rules for discretionary QNECs or QMACs, including details on allocation methods, applicable periods, and specific business unit requirements.

title: D - Contributions - Employer Matching : Rollovers

fields.name: Rollover Contributions are permitted (nondiscriminatory availability of benefits, rights, and features includes rollovers and must be available on a nondiscriminatory basis)
fields.desc: Rollover contributions must be available to all eligible participants on a nondiscriminatory basis, as defined in Treas. Reg. 1.401(a)(4)-4 (including the definition in 1.401(a)(4)-4(e)(3)(iii)(I)).

fields.name: Describe the employees/Participants eligible to make rollover contributions

title: D - Contributions - Employer Matching : Deemed IRAs

fields.name: The Plan may accept voluntary contributions to deemed IRAs
fields.desc: Indicate whether the plan permits participants to make voluntary contributions to deemed IRAs.

title: D - Contributions - Employer Matching : Death or Disability During Military Service

fields.name: For benefit accrual purposes, a Participant that dies or becomes Disabled while performing qualified military service will be treated as if he had been employed by the Employer on the day preceding death or Disability
fields.desc: If selected, a participant who dies or becomes disabled while on qualified military service is treated as employed on the day before the event for benefit accrual purposes. This ensures that benefit accruals for the military service period are based on the participant’s average contributions immediately prior to service, thereby equalizing benefits for those who die during service with those who return to work under USERRA.

title: D - Contributions - Employer Matching : 415 Additional Language

fields.name: Additional language necessary to satisfy Code section 415 because of the required aggregation of multiple plans:
fields.desc: Indicate whether additional language is required to comply with Code section 415 due to the aggregation of multiple plans.

fields.name: Enter additional 415 language
fields.desc: Provide the specific additional language needed to meet Code section 415 requirements.

title: E - Vesting : Vesting Service Computation Rules

fields.name: Vesting service computation method
fields.desc: Choose 'Hours of Service' if actual hours are tracked; choose 'Elapsed Time' if not. Under 'Elapsed Time', continuous service is credited provided at least one hour is accrued in the first and last month, with no 12-month break.

fields.name: Number of Hours of Service necessary for Year of Vesting Service (1000 maximum without commas)
fields.desc: Enter the required number of service hours (up to 1000) that count as one year of vesting service.

fields.name: Select equivalency for vesting purposes
fields.desc: Select the conversion factor for hours of service, applicable only if 'Hours of Service' is chosen.

fields.name: The equivalency shall apply to
fields.desc: Specify which employees the selected hours equivalency applies to.

fields.name: Vesting Computation Period
fields.desc: Enter the period used to calculate vesting service.

fields.name: Describe the other Vesting Computation Period (must be a consecutive 12-month period)
fields.desc: Provide an alternative consecutive 12-month period, for example, 'April 1 through March 31'.

title: E - Vesting : Other Employer Service

fields.name: Count years of service with other non-affiliated employers for vesting purposes
fields.desc: Include years of service from other non-affiliated employers when computing vesting, in addition to service with affiliated or predecessor employers which is always counted.

fields.name: List other non-affiliated employers and indicate for what purposes (e.g., Elective Deferrals, Employer Matching, etc.) the service applies
fields.desc: To credit vesting service from non-affiliated employers, list the employer's name, the applicable plan feature (e.g., Employer Matching), any maximum years of service allowed, and the effective date. For example: 'Effective July 1, 2021, ABC Co. for purposes of Employer Matching Contributions only, and for a maximum of 3 years of service.'

title: E - Vesting : Vesting Exceptions

fields.name: Full vesting at death. Provide for full vesting for a Participant who Terminates employment with the Employer due to death while an Employee
fields.desc: Ensure that a participant who dies while employed is granted full vesting of benefits.

fields.name: Full vesting at Disability. Provide for full vesting for a Participant who Terminates employment with the Employer due to Disability while an Employee
fields.desc: Provide full vesting for a participant who terminates employment due to disability.

fields.name: Full vesting at Early Retirement. Provide for 100% vesting upon the attainment of Early Retirement Date while an Employee
fields.desc: Grant 100% vesting immediately upon a participant reaching the early retirement date.

title: E - Vesting : Vesting Exclusions

fields.name: Exclude Years of Vesting Service earned before age 18
fields.desc: Exclude any vesting service accrued before the participant reached age 18.

fields.name: Exclude Years of Vesting Service earned before the Employer maintained this Plan or a predecessor plan
fields.desc: Do not count vesting service earned prior to the date the employer began maintaining this Plan or its predecessor plan.

fields.name: One-year holdout. If an Employee has a 1-Year Break in Service/Period of Severance, exclude Years of Vesting Service before such period until the Employee has completed a Year of Vesting Service after return to employment with the Employer
fields.desc: Under the one-year holdout rule, any vesting service accrued before a one-year break is excluded. A rehired employee will not receive credit for previously earned vesting service until they complete one full year of service following rehire.

fields.name: Rule of parity. If an Employee does not have a nonforfeitable right to Employer contributions, exclude Years of Vesting Service earned before a period of 5 consecutive 1-Year Breaks in Service/Periods of Severance
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' to exclude all prior vesting service for a rehired employee who, at termination, had no vested employer contributions and then experienced five consecutive one-year breaks in service. This means no previous service will count toward vesting. Select 'No' if all service should be counted regardless of breaks.

title: E - Vesting : Special Vesting Provisions

fields.name: Provide for special vesting provisions
fields.desc: Any special vesting provisions must comply with Code sections 401(a)(4) and 411.

fields.name: Describe special vesting provisions
fields.desc: Describe any special vesting rules (e.g., 'Employer Matching Contributions made prior to January 1, 2007 shall continue to vest in accordance with the prior 7-year graded vesting schedule') without a period at the end.

title: E - Vesting : Employer Match Vesting

fields.name: Employer Matching Contribution Account Vesting Schedule
fields.desc: Select '100%' for immediate vesting. Otherwise, choose the applicable schedule (e.g., '2-6 Year Graded', '1-5 Year Graded', '1-4 Year Graded', '3 Year Cliff', or '2 Year Cliff') as defined in the Adoption Agreement.

fields.name: Other Employer Matching Schedule - less than 1 year (without % sign)
fields.desc: Enter the vesting percentage for periods less than 1 year. It must vest no slower than the '3 Year Cliff' or '2-6 Year Graded' schedules.

fields.name: Other Employer Matching Schedule - 1 year but less than 2 years (without % sign)
fields.desc: Enter the vesting percentage for service of 1 to less than 2 years, ensuring vesting is at least as rapid as the '3 Year Cliff' or '2-6 Year Graded' schedule.

fields.name: Other Employer Matching Schedule - 2 years but less than 3 years (without % sign)
fields.desc: Enter the vesting percentage for service of 2 to less than 3 years, with vesting no slower than the '3 Year Cliff' or '2-6 Year Graded' schedule.

fields.name: Other Employer Matching Schedule - 3 years but less than 4 years (without % sign)
fields.desc: Enter the vesting percentage for service of 3 to less than 4 years. Vesting must be at least as rapid as the '3 Year Cliff' or '2-6 Year Graded' schedule.

fields.name: Other Employer Matching Schedule - 4 years but less than 5 years (without % sign)
fields.desc: Enter the vesting percentage for service of 4 to less than 5 years, ensuring it meets or exceeds the '3 Year Cliff' or '2-6 Year Graded' pace.

fields.name: Other Employer Matching Schedule - 5 years but less than 6 years (without % sign)
fields.desc: Enter the vesting percentage for service of 5 to less than 6 years, with vesting at least as rapid as the '3 Year Cliff' or '2-6 Year Graded' schedule.

title: E - Vesting : Non-Elective Vesting

fields.name: Non-Elective Contribution Account Vesting Schedule
fields.desc: Select '100%' if Non-Elective Contributions vest immediately. Otherwise, choose the applicable vesting schedule (e.g., '2-6 Year Graded', '1-5 Year Graded', '1-4 Year Graded', '3 Year Cliff', '2 Year Cliff') as defined in the plan.

fields.name: Other Non-Elective Schedule - less than 1 year (without % sign)
fields.desc: Enter the vesting percentage for service less than 1 year. The schedule must vest no slower than the '3 Year Cliff' or '2-6 Year Graded' schedule.

fields.name: Other Non-Elective Schedule - 1 year but less than 2 years (without % sign)
fields.desc: Enter the vesting percentage for service of at least 1 year but less than 2 years, ensuring vesting is at least as rapid as the '3 Year Cliff' or '2-6 Year Graded' schedule.

fields.name: Other Non-Elective Schedule - 2 years but less than 3 years (without % sign)
fields.desc: Enter the vesting percentage for service of at least 2 years but less than 3 years, with vesting no slower than the '3 Year Cliff' or '2-6 Year Graded' schedule.

fields.name: Other Non-Elective Schedule - 3 years but less than 4 years (without % sign)
fields.desc: Enter the vesting percentage for service of at least 3 years but less than 4 years, ensuring vesting is as rapid as the '3 Year Cliff' or '2-6 Year Graded' schedule.

fields.name: Other Non-Elective Schedule - 4 years but less than 5 years (without % sign)
fields.desc: Enter the vesting percentage for service of at least 4 years but less than 5 years, with vesting no slower than the '3 Year Cliff' or '2-6 Year Graded' schedule.

fields.name: Other Non-Elective Schedule - 5 years but less than 6 years (without % sign)
fields.desc: Enter the vesting percentage for service of at least 5 years but less than 6 years, ensuring vesting meets or exceeds the pace of the '3 Year Cliff' or '2-6 Year Graded' schedule.

title: E - Vesting : QACA Vesting

fields.name: Specify the vesting schedule for QACA contributions
fields.desc: Enter '100%' if QACA Matching/Non-Elective Contributions vest immediately. Otherwise, choose a vesting schedule for these contributions that does not exceed a 2-Year Cliff.

fields.name: Other QACA Schedule - less than 1 year (without % sign)
fields.desc: Enter the vesting percentage for service less than 1 year, ensuring it complies with the maximum allowed by the 2-Year Cliff schedule.

fields.name: Other QACA Schedule - 1 year but less than 2 years (without % sign)
fields.desc: Enter the vesting percentage for service of at least 1 year but less than 2 years, not exceeding the 2-Year Cliff maximum.

title: E - Vesting : Other Vesting

fields.name: Plan has a vesting schedule other than the schedules described above
fields.desc: Specify that the plan applies a different vesting schedule (e.g., for assets from an old money purchase plan) that must be consistently and nondiscriminatorily applied and meet Code section 411(a)(2) minimum requirements.

fields.name: Describe the other schedule (must be applied in a consistent and nondiscriminatory manner and must satisfy the applicable minimum vesting requirements of Code section 411(a)(2) at every point in time, for all Participants' years of service)
fields.desc: Provide a detailed description of the alternative vesting schedule, ensuring it meets Code sections 401(a)(4) and 411 requirements. For example, indicate that a 2-6 year graded schedule will apply to merged funds.

fields.name: Describe the Participants to which the other schedule applies (must be applied in a consistent and nondiscriminatory manner)
fields.desc: Describe which participants are subject to the alternative vesting schedule in a consistent and nondiscriminatory manner, ensuring compliance with Code section 411(a)(2).

fields.name: Retain old Non-Elective Vesting for pre 2007 contributions
fields.desc: Indicate whether the vesting schedule for Non-Elective Contributions made before 2007 is retained.

fields.name: Describe Non-Elective Vesting for pre 2007 contributions
fields.desc: Provide details on how pre-2007 Non-Elective Contributions will continue to vest under the schedule that was in effect prior to January 1, 2007.

title: E - Vesting : Use of Forfeitures

fields.name: Forfeitures will be used in the following manner
fields.desc: Select 'Any permissible method' to allow forfeitures to be used for any purpose allowed under Section 6.03(d) (e.g., paying plan expenses, reducing employer contributions, repaying prior forfeitures). Alternatively, select 'Other' and specify limited uses, such as using forfeitures from matching contributions to reduce future matching or reallocating forfeitures from non-elective contributions on a pro rata basis.

fields.name: Describe Other (limited to one or a combination of the options described in Article 6, may be used to further restrict the uses of forfeiture, and must be applied in a consistent and nondiscriminatory manner)
fields.desc: Provide a detailed description of the limited uses of forfeitures if 'Other' is selected. For example: 'Forfeitures from Matching Contributions will reduce the Employer’s future Matching Contributions, while forfeitures from Non-Elective Contributions will be reallocated on a pro rata basis to all eligible Participants.'

title: F - Distributions : Normal Retirement

fields.name: Requirement for Normal Retirement Age
fields.desc: Define the criteria that must be met for a participant to be eligible for Normal Retirement benefits.

fields.name: Age component of Normal Retirement Age (not to exceed 65 - if age is less than 59-1/2, it will be deemed to be 59-1/2 for Elective Deferrals, QNECs, etc.)
fields.desc: Enter the age used in determining Normal Retirement. If the actual age is below 59½, it is treated as 59½, with the maximum capped at 65.

fields.name: Select the type of service to measure Normal Retirement Age
fields.desc: Choose the service metric (e.g., years of service or participation anniversary) that will be used to determine when Normal Retirement is achieved.

fields.name: Enter years of service (e.g. "2" or "4") or anniversary of participation (e.g., "first" or "second")
fields.desc: Specify the required service level. Normal Retirement is deemed met no later than the later of age 65 or the fifth anniversary of participation.

fields.name: Normal Retirement Date means
fields.desc: Define the effective date at which a participant is considered to have reached Normal Retirement.

fields.name: Define Other Normal Retirement Date (see Help Text for Note on defining NRA)
fields.desc: Provide an alternative definition for the Normal Retirement Date, such as 'first payroll coincident with or immediately following the date the age and service requirements are met' or 'first day of the calendar month during which the requirements are met'.

title: F - Distributions : Early Retirement

fields.name: Early Retirement Age means (see Help Text for Note on early retirement benefits)
fields.desc: Define the requirements for early retirement. If 'Later of age and service' is selected and a participant leaves before meeting the age requirement (but after meeting the service requirement), they can elect early retirement upon reaching the required age. See related provisions in D.5e, D.19e, E.5c, and in-service distributions upon Early Retirement Date.

fields.name: Age component of Early Retirement Age (not to exceed 65 - deemed to be 59.5 for Elective Deferrals and QNECs if lesser age is entered)
fields.desc: Enter the age used for early retirement, with a maximum of 65. If a lower age is provided, it is deemed 59.5 for purposes of Elective Deferrals and QNECs.

fields.name: Select the type of service used to measure Early Retirement Age
fields.desc: Choose the service measurement method (e.g., years of service or anniversary of participation) for determining early retirement eligibility.

fields.name: Enter years of service (e.g. "5" or "10") or anniversary of participation (e.g., "fifteenth" or "twentieth")
fields.desc: Specify the service requirement—either in years or as an anniversary—for early retirement eligibility.

fields.name: Early Retirement Date means
fields.desc: Define the effective date at which early retirement is considered to have been achieved.

fields.name: Define Other Early Retirement Date
fields.desc: Provide an alternative definition for the Early Retirement Date, such as 'first payroll coincident with or next following the date ERA age and service requirements are met' or 'first day of the calendar month during which ERA age and service requirements are met'.

title: F - Distributions : Time and Form of Payment after Termination for Reasons other than Death

fields.name: Distributions after Termination of Employment for reasons other than death shall commence
fields.desc: Choose when distributions begin after termination (e.g., Immediate, End of Plan Year, Normal Retirement Date, or Other with a specified timing). Any timing must comply with Code section 401(a)(9) and Article 7 requirements.

fields.name: Enter other time when distributions after Termination of Employment commence
fields.desc: Provide a specific alternative timing (for example, 'end of the quarter following termination') that complies with Code section 401(a)(9) and Article 7.

fields.name: Medium of post-severance distributions from the Plan:
fields.desc: Select the medium (cash, in-kind, etc.) for post-severance distributions; note that this does not apply to in-service distributions, which can be paid in cash or in-kind.

fields.name: Unless otherwise elected by the Participant, distributions shall be made in the form of
fields.desc: Specify the default form of distribution, such as lump sum, installment, annuity, or another permitted method.

fields.name: If QJSA, enter percentage of survivor portion of Qualified Joint and Survivor Annuity (50-100 without % sign)
fields.desc: Enter the percentage for the survivor portion of a Qualified Joint and Survivor Annuity, using a value between 50 and 100.

fields.name: Distributions from the Plan after Termination for reasons other than death may be made in the form of Lump Sum Only
fields.desc: Select this option if distributions are to be made as a single lump sum.

fields.name: Distributions in the form of Lump sum and Installments
fields.desc: Select if distributions can be made partly as a lump sum and partly in installments.

fields.name: Distributions in the form of partial withdrawals
fields.desc: Choose this option for partial withdrawals, ensuring the method complies with Code section 401(a)(9) and Article 7 requirements.

fields.name: Other permitted form of distribution
fields.desc: Select this if a form of distribution other than those listed is permitted, subject to compliance with Code section 401(a)(9) and Article 7.

fields.name: Describe other payment forms that apply uniformly to Participants (must comply with Code section 401(a)(9) and requirements of Article 7)
fields.desc: Provide a description of any other uniform distribution methods (e.g., 'lump sum, installments, or annuity') that meet all regulatory requirements.

fields.name: Partial or installment distributions will be permitted only to satisfy the required minimum distribution rules
fields.desc: Indicate that partial or installment payments are allowed solely to satisfy required minimum distribution rules.

fields.name: Permit distributions in the form of an annuity
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' to allow annuity distributions, 'No' to disallow them, or 'Yes - with Limitations' if only certain annuity options are available. Note that allowing annuities subjects the plan to survivor annuity requirements under Section 7.10.

fields.name: Describe the limits on distributions in the form of an annuity (i.e. only for certain investments)
fields.desc: Describe any restrictions on annuity distributions (e.g., limiting them to accounts above a certain dollar threshold or only permitting specific investment options such as a longevity annuity).

fields.name: Beneficiary may elect to apply its share of Participant's vested Account balance toward the purchase of an annuity for the life of such Beneficiary
fields.desc: Select whether beneficiaries can choose to have their share of the vested balance used to purchase an annuity, subject to survivor annuity requirements if elected.

fields.name: Describe the limits on distributions in the form of an annuity (i.e. only if the beneficiary is a spouse)
fields.desc: Provide any conditions or limitations for annuity distributions available to beneficiaries (e.g., restrictions applying only to spouses), ensuring these limits are applied consistently and nondiscriminatorily.

title: F - Distributions : Transfer from Pension Plan

fields.name: The Plan has received a transfer of assets from a plan subject to the survivor annuity rules of Code sections 401(a)(11) and 417
fields.desc: Select 'No' if the Plan has never received a transfer from another plan (Money Purchase or Defined Benefit) subject to the survivor annuity rules. Select 'Yes' only if assets were transferred via a non-elective trustee-to-trustee transfer where the survivor annuity rules were maintained. This selection will subject the Transfer Account to the survivor annuity requirements of Section 7.10. Note that if Hardship Withdrawals or Specified Age Withdrawals are allowed from the Transfer Account, an error will be indicated.

fields.name: Provide the name of the transfer plan (optional):
fields.desc: Enter the name of the plan from which assets were transferred (optional).

fields.name: Transfer effective date (optional):
fields.desc: Enter the effective date of the asset transfer (optional).

fields.name: Other transfer information (optional):
fields.desc: Provide any additional relevant details regarding the transfer (optional).

title: F - Distributions : Spousal Beneficiary Percentage

fields.name: To the extent that a Participant's Account is subject to the survivor annuity rules, the spouse of a married Participant shall be the beneficiary of the following percentage of such Participant's Account (No less than 50%; do not enter % sign)
fields.desc: Enter the percentage (minimum 50) of the participant’s account that the spouse is entitled to as beneficiary, unless the spouse waives this right per Section 7.10. Refer to Section 7.10 to confirm if the plan is subject to survivor annuity rules.

title: F - Distributions : Payment on Participant Death

fields.name: Distributions on account of the death of the Participant shall be made in accordance with one of the following
fields.desc: Select the method by which death benefit distributions are made, such as immediate distribution, lump sum, or in accordance with survivor annuity rules.

fields.name: Describe other distributions (must comply with Code section 401(a)(9) and requirements of Article 7)
fields.desc: Provide a detailed description of any alternative distribution timing or methods for death benefits. For example: 'Distribution shall be made to the spouse of a deceased Participant at the election of the spouse as soon as administratively feasible six months following the Participant's date of death.'

title: F - Distributions : Beneficiaries

fields.name: Death benefit policy when there is no designated beneficiary
fields.desc: Select 'Standard' if the death benefit goes to the participant's spouse; if no spouse, to the children equally; if no children, to the estate. Otherwise, select 'Other' and provide a definite, nondiscretionary description.

fields.name: Describe the Plan's policy for handling benefits when there is no designated beneficiary
fields.desc: Provide a clear, nondiscretionary description (e.g., 'All assets will be awarded to the Estate' or 'Per Stirpes').

fields.name: A beneficiary designation of a spouse shall be automatically revoked upon the legal divorce of the Participant and the spouse
fields.desc: Indicate that a spouse designation is automatically revoked if the participant legally divorces.

fields.name: For purposes of determining a Participant's spouse, the one-year rule in Code section 417(d), Treas. Reg. section 1.401(a)-20 applies
fields.desc: Select 'YES' if the participant must be married for one year before the spouse is recognized for plan purposes; select 'NO' if recognition is immediate.

title: F - Distributions : Force Out

fields.name: Involuntary force-out of small balances
fields.desc: Indicate whether the plan mandates an involuntary force-out of small account balances.

fields.name: Enter maximum involuntary force-out (No commas or dollar signs; $5,000 maximum)
fields.desc: Enter the maximum threshold for mandatory force-outs for small balances, as per Section 7.03. For example, enter '1000' to apply a $1,000 force-out limit, which will be used to determine eligibility for automatic rollover provisions.

fields.name: Exclude amounts attributable to Rollover Contributions in determining the value of the Participant's nonforfeitable account balance for purposes of the Plan's involuntary force-out rules
fields.desc: Specify whether amounts from rollover contributions are excluded when calculating the nonforfeitable balance subject to force-out. If the force-out limit is less than $1,000 to avoid rollover rules, select 'No'.

fields.name: Force-outs will be subject to automatic rollover rules if above (No commas or dollar signs; $1,000 maximum)
fields.desc: Enter the amount subject to automatic rollover if the force-out threshold is $1,000 or less. This should match the force-out threshold to trigger automatic rollover provisions.

fields.name: Minimum Account balance for Qualified Joint and Survivor Annuity consent requirements (No commas or dollar signs; $5,000 maximum)
fields.desc: Specify the minimum account balance required for the Qualified Joint and Survivor Annuity consent rules under Section 7.10. For example, '1000' indicates a $1,000 threshold.

fields.name: Describe other involuntary force-out timeframe
fields.desc: Describe any alternative timeframes for initiating force-out distributions, if different from the standard period.

fields.name: Describe other conditions for deferral (must comply with Code section 411(a)(11) and requirements of Article 7)
fields.desc: Provide additional conditions or restrictions for deferring force-out distributions. Ensure the description complies with Code section 411(a)(11) and Article 7 requirements. For example: 'Force-out distributions may be deferred until the end of the plan year if certain account conditions are met.'

title: F - Distributions : Required Beginning Date

fields.name: Required Beginning Date for a Participant other than a More Than 5% Owner
fields.desc: Specify the Required Beginning Date—a protected benefit under Code section 411(d)(6)—for participants who are not more than 5% owners.

title: G - In-service Withdrawals : Normal/Early Retirement

fields.name: Allow in-service distributions after attainment of Normal Retirement Date
fields.desc: If the Normal Retirement Date is less than age 59½, in-service withdrawals are not permitted for Elective Deferrals, Qualified Non-Elective Contributions, Qualified Matching Contributions, or safe harbor funds until the participant reaches age 59½.

fields.name: Describe the Accounts from which distributions may be made
fields.desc: Specify which account(s) are eligible for in-service distributions. 'All Accounts' may be used unless restricted by a transfer of assets from a plan subject to survivor annuity rules and a Normal Retirement Age under 62.

fields.name: Allow in-service distributions after attainment of Early Retirement Date
fields.desc: If the Early Retirement Date is less than age 59½, withdrawals for Elective Deferrals, Qualified Non-Elective Contributions, Qualified Matching Contributions, and safe harbor funds are deferred until age 59½.

fields.name: Describe the Accounts from which in-service distributions may be made
fields.desc: Define the eligible account(s) for in-service withdrawals under early retirement. 'All Accounts' is typical unless limited by asset transfers and if the Normal Retirement Age is less than 62.

title: G - In-service Withdrawals : Hardship

fields.name: Hardship withdrawals are allowed from the portion of a Participant's Accounts described below. (If "None", questions regarding Hardship withdrawals are disregarded.)
fields.desc: Specify which types of participant accounts are eligible for hardship withdrawals. If 'None' is selected, all subsequent hardship withdrawal questions are ignored.

fields.name: Hardship withdrawal is permitted from Elective Deferral Account
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if hardship withdrawals are allowed from a participant’s Elective Deferral Account, excluding earnings credited after the later of December 31, 1988, and the end of the last Plan Year ending before July 1, 1989.

fields.name: Hardship withdrawal is permitted from Employer Matching Contribution Account
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if hardship withdrawals are permitted from the Employer Matching Contribution Account, except for the portion used to satisfy safe harbor requirements.

fields.name: Hardship withdrawal is permitted from Non-Elective Contribution Account
fields.desc: Indicate if hardship withdrawals are allowed from the Non-Elective Contribution Account.

fields.name: Hardship withdrawal is permitted from Voluntary Contribution Account
fields.desc: Indicate if hardship withdrawals are allowed from the Voluntary Contribution Account.

fields.name: Hardship withdrawal is permitted from Rollover Contribution Account
fields.desc: Specify if hardship withdrawals are permitted from the Rollover Contribution Account.

fields.name: Hardship withdrawal is permitted from Transfer Account
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if hardship withdrawals may be made from the Transfer Account, excluding assets from plans subject to survivor annuity rules.

fields.name: Hardship withdrawal is permitted from Other Account
fields.desc: Indicate if hardship withdrawals are allowed from any other types of accounts.

fields.name: Describe Other selected Account(s) Hardship withdrawal is permitted
fields.desc: Provide details on any additional account types from which hardship withdrawals are allowed.

fields.name: The criteria used in determining whether a Participant is entitled to receive a Hardship withdrawal
fields.desc: Select the eligibility criteria for hardship withdrawals: either the Safe Harbor criteria from Section 8.01(b) or the Non Safe Harbor criteria from Section 8.01(c).

fields.name: A more flexible Hardship option applies to permitted Account(s)
fields.desc: Specify if a flexible hardship option is available for accounts not subject to Treas. Reg. 1.401(k)-1(d). Under this option, the withdrawal amount cannot exceed the participant’s vested interest, and Revenue Ruling 71-224 (and any updates) will apply.

fields.name: Select the criteria that applies to more flexible Hardship option
fields.desc: Choose the specific criteria under which the flexible hardship option is applied.

fields.name: Describe any additional modifications
fields.desc: Provide any extra modifications or conditions that apply under the flexible hardship option.

fields.name: Expand the Hardship criteria to include the beneficiary of the Participant
fields.desc: Indicate if the hardship criteria extend to a primary beneficiary for expenses (e.g., medical, tuition, funeral) as defined by the plan. A primary beneficiary is one with an unconditional right to the participant's account upon death.

fields.name: If Roth Elective Deferrals are permitted and hardships allowed from Elective Deferral Account, permit hardships from Roth Elective Deferral Account
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if hardship withdrawals from the Roth Elective Deferral Account are allowed under the same terms as for the Elective Deferral Account, or 'Yes - only if qualified distribution' if withdrawals must qualify under Code section 402A(d)(2). Select 'No' if not allowed.

fields.name: Other limitations on Hardship withdrawals
fields.desc: Specify any additional limitations on hardship withdrawals (e.g., limits on frequency or minimum amounts). Any minimum withdrawal amount must not exceed $1,000.

fields.name: Describe any Other limitations on Hardship withdrawals
fields.desc: Provide further details on any additional limitations on hardship withdrawals. All limitations must be objective and nondiscriminatory, and any minimum amount must not exceed $1,000.

title: G - In-service Withdrawals : Hardship Addendum

fields.name: Effective on the first day of the first plan year after December 31, 2018, hardship distributions may be taken from earnings on all Elective Deferrals:
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if, effective from the first day of the first plan year after December 31, 2018 (e.g., January 1, 2019 for calendar year-end plans), hardship distributions are allowed from earnings on all elective deferrals. Select 'No' if the plan does not permit such withdrawals, or if the effective date is later.

fields.name: Hardship distributions are available from earnings on all Elective Deferrals later than the first day of the first plan year after December 31, 2018:
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if hardship distributions from earnings on all deferrals are allowed but the effective date is later than the first day of the first plan year after December 31, 2018; select 'No' if they remain limited to those grandfathered under prior rules.

fields.name: Earnings on all Elective Deferrals available effective:
fields.desc: Enter the effective date (later than the first day of the first plan year after December 31, 2018) when hardship distributions become available from earnings on all deferrals.

fields.name: Effective on the first day of the first plan year after December 31, 2018, if available under the Plan, safe harbor contributions, QNECs or QMACs will be available for hardship distributions:
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if, effective from the first day of the first plan year after December 31, 2018, hardship distributions are allowed from safe harbor contributions, QNECs, or QMACs; otherwise, select 'No' if not permitted or if effective later.

fields.name: Hardship distributions are permitted from safe harbor contributions, QNECs or QMACs:
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if hardship distributions from safe harbor contributions, QNECs, or QMACs are permitted (with an effective date later than the first day of the first plan year after December 31, 2018), or 'No' if not allowed.

fields.name: Hardship distributions are permitted from safe harbor contributions, QNECs or QMACs effective:
fields.desc: Enter the effective date when hardship distributions from safe harbor contributions, QNECs, or QMACs become available, which must be later than the first day of the first plan year after December 31, 2018.

fields.name: Effective on the first day of the first plan year after December 31, 2018, a hardship distribution will be determined to satisfy an immediate and heavy financial need only if the three criteria described in help text are met:
fields.desc: Indicate whether the following criteria are used to determine if a hardship distribution is necessary to satisfy an immediate and heavy financial need: (1) the requested distribution does not exceed the amount required (including taxes/penalties), (2) the participant has exhausted all other available distributions from any deferred compensation plan, and (3) effective for distributions on or after January 1, 2020, the participant has provided a written representation of insufficient liquid assets.

fields.name: A hardship distribution will be determined to satisfy an immediate and heavy financial need only if the three criteria described in help text are met:
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if the hardship distribution is determined based on the criteria described, with an effective date later than the first day of the first plan year after December 31, 2018; select 'No' if different criteria are used.

fields.name: Effective date for provisions to comply with the amount necessary to satisfy need requirement:
fields.desc: Enter the effective date for the hardship need determination provisions, which must be later than the first day of the first plan year after December 2018.

fields.name: The following provisions for complying with the amount necessary to satisfy need requirement will be used (include the effective date):
fields.desc: Describe the criteria used to determine if a hardship distribution is necessary to satisfy an immediate and heavy financial need, and include the effective date for these provisions.

fields.name: Effective on the first day of the first plan year after December 31, 2018, the six-month suspension period will no longer be a condition for obtaining a hardship distribution, even if the hardship distribution was made in the prior plan year:
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if the six-month suspension period has been removed as of the first day of the first plan year after December 31, 2018, or 'No' if it was removed later or not at all.

fields.name: Plan will not initiate a six-month suspension period effective:
fields.desc: Enter the effective date for the removal of the six-month suspension period. This date cannot be later than the date for distributions on or after January 1, 2020.

fields.name: Plan will discontinue any remaining suspension period for hardship distributions made prior to the entered effective date:
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if any remaining suspension period from prior hardship distributions will be discontinued as of the effective date; select 'No' if the suspension continues.

fields.name: Effective on the first day of the first plan year after December 31, 2018, Participants are not required to take all loans prior to applying for a hardship distribution:
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if participants are no longer required to take all nontaxable loans before applying for a hardship distribution effective from the first day of the first plan year after December 2018; select 'No' if they are still required to take all loans.

fields.name: Participants must take all nontaxable loans under all plans maintained by the Employer before applying for a hardship distribution:
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if participants will still be required to take all nontaxable loans (under all employer plans) as of the effective date; select 'No' if they are not required.

fields.name: Participants are not required to take all available nontaxable loans before applying for a hardship distribution effective:
fields.desc: Enter the effective date when participants are no longer required to take all available nontaxable loans before applying for a hardship distribution.

fields.name: Expenses qualifying for casualty deduction and expenses incurred on account of federally declared disasters considered as safe harbor criteria for hardship distributions made on or after January 1, 2018:
fields.desc: Specify that, for hardship distributions made on or after January 1, 2018, expenses for repairs (qualifying under Code section 165) and expenses due to federally declared disasters (per FEMA under the Stafford Act) are treated as safe harbor criteria. Note that post-TCJA, casualty losses do not need to be in a federally declared disaster area.

fields.name: Added or modified immediate and heavy financial needs considered as safe harbor criteria for hardship distributions later than the first day of the first plan year after December 31, 2018:
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if the plan uses the specified criteria for determining if a hardship distribution is necessary to meet an immediate and heavy financial need, with an effective date later than the first day of the first plan year after December 31, 2018; select 'No' if different criteria are used.

fields.name: The immediate and heavy financial needs considered as safe harbor criteria effective:
fields.desc: Enter the effective date when the immediate and heavy financial need criteria for hardship distributions become applicable.

fields.name: Plan sponsor signature line is required:
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if a plan sponsor signature is required due to deviations from default provisions or effective dates; select 'No' if all defaults are used and no signature is needed.

title: G - In-service Withdrawals : Specified Age and Service

fields.name: In-service withdrawals are allowed on attainment of certain age and service
fields.desc: Select 'None' if in-service withdrawals are not permitted or if only an age requirement (without a service requirement) applies. (See G.4a for more details.)

fields.name: In-service withdrawal permitted after age (deemed to be 59-1/2 for Elective Deferrals and QNECs if age less than 59-1/2 is entered)
fields.desc: Generally, the minimum age is 59½ to avoid tax penalties. If a lower age is entered, it will be treated as 59½ for purposes of Elective Deferrals, Qualified Non-Elective Contributions, Qualified Matching Contributions, and any funds used to satisfy safe harbor requirements.

fields.name: Describe service required
fields.desc: Provide the service requirement (e.g., '5 years of service'). If no service requirement applies, in-service withdrawal details should be entered under G.5 instead of G.4.

fields.name: Specified age and service withdrawal is permitted from Elective Deferral Account.
fields.desc: Withdrawals from the Elective Deferral Account are allowed only if the participant is at least 59½.

fields.name: Specified age and service withdrawal is permitted from Employer Matching Contribution Account.
fields.desc: Withdrawals from the Employer Matching Contribution Account require the participant to be at least 59½, applicable to Qualified Matching Contributions and funds used for safe harbor purposes.

fields.name: Specified age and service withdrawal is permitted from Non-Elective Contribution Account.
fields.desc: Indicate whether withdrawals are permitted from the Non-Elective Contribution Account.

fields.name: Specified age and service withdrawal is permitted from Qualified Nonelective Contribution Account.
fields.desc: Withdrawals from the Qualified Non-Elective Contribution Account are allowed only if the participant is at least 59½.

fields.name: Specified age and service withdrawal is permitted from Voluntary Contribution Account.
fields.desc: Select 'No' if in-service withdrawals are not permitted or if they are allowed at any time (per G.7a) from the Voluntary Contribution Account.

fields.name: Specified age and service withdrawal is permitted from Rollover Contribution Account.
fields.desc: Select 'No' if in-service withdrawals are not permitted or if they are available 'at any time' (per G.7b) from the Rollover Contribution Account.

fields.name: Specified age and service withdrawal is permitted from Transfer Account.
fields.desc: Withdrawals from the Transfer Account are permitted, but if the plan has received a transfer of assets from a plan subject to survivor annuity rules (F.7a = 'Yes'), the minimum withdrawal age cannot be less than 62.

fields.name: Specified age and service withdrawal is permitted from Other
fields.desc: Indicate if withdrawals are permitted from any other account types.

fields.name: Describe other accounts withdrawals are permitted
fields.desc: Provide details on which other account types allow in-service withdrawals.

fields.name: If Roth Elective Deferrals are permitted and specified age and service withdrawals are allowed from Elective Deferral Account, Permit specified age withdrawals from Roth Elective Deferral Account
fields.desc: Specify whether, if Roth Elective Deferrals are allowed, the same age and service requirements apply for withdrawals from the Roth Elective Deferral Account.

title: G - In-service Withdrawals : Specified Age

fields.name: In-service withdrawals are allowed on attainment of a specified age
fields.desc: Select 'None' if in-service withdrawals are not permitted or if only an age requirement applies (without a service requirement).

fields.name: In-service withdrawal permitted after age (deemed to be 59-1/2 for Electives and QNECs if age less than 59-1/2 is entered)
fields.desc: Enter the minimum age required for withdrawals. For Elective Deferrals, QNECs, and Matching Contributions used for safe harbor purposes, this must be at least 59½.

fields.name: Specified age withdrawal is permitted from Elective Deferral Account.
fields.desc: Withdrawals from the Elective Deferral Account require a minimum age of 59½.

fields.name: Specified age withdrawal is permitted from Employer Matching Contribution Account.
fields.desc: Withdrawals from the Employer Matching Contribution Account require the participant to be at least 59½, in line with safe harbor requirements.

fields.name: Specified age withdrawal is permitted from Non-Elective Contribution Account.
fields.desc: Specify whether withdrawals are permitted from the Non-Elective Contribution Account at the specified age.

fields.name: Specified age withdrawal is permitted from Qualified Nonelective Contribution Account.
fields.desc: Withdrawals from the Qualified Nonelective Contribution Account require a minimum age of 59½.

fields.name: Specified age withdrawal is permitted from Voluntary Contribution Account.
fields.desc: Select 'No' if withdrawals are not allowed or if they are available at any time under G.7a.

fields.name: Specified age withdrawal is permitted from Rollover Contribution Account.
fields.desc: Select 'No' if withdrawals are not permitted or are available at any time under G.7b.

fields.name: Specified age withdrawal is permitted from Transfer Account.
fields.desc: Withdrawals from the Transfer Account are allowed, but if assets were transferred from a plan under survivor annuity rules, the minimum age must be at least 62.

fields.name: Specified Age withdrawal is permitted from Other Account
fields.desc: Specify if withdrawals are permitted from any other account types under the specified age requirement.

fields.name: Describe Other Account
fields.desc: Provide details on the other account types eligible for specified age withdrawals.

fields.name: If Roth Elective Deferrals are permitted and specified age withdrawals are allowed from Elective Deferral Account, permit specified age withdrawals from Roth Elective Deferral Account
fields.desc: Select 'NO' if specified age withdrawals are not allowed from the Roth Elective Deferral Account. Otherwise, choose 'Yes' for the same terms or 'Yes - only if qualified distribution' if withdrawals must qualify as a 'qualified distribution' under Code section 402A(d)(2).

title: G - In-service Withdrawals : Other Withdrawals

fields.name: In-service withdrawals allowed from Employer Matching Contribution Account after a specified number of years of Participation
fields.desc: Specify that withdrawals from the Employer Matching Contribution Account are allowed after a minimum participation period; however, if the service requirement is met before age 59½, withdrawals are limited to amounts not used to satisfy safe harbor requirements until age 59½.

fields.name: In-service withdrawals allowed from Non-Elective Contribution Account after a specified number of years of Participation
fields.desc: Indicate if withdrawals from the Non-Elective Contribution Account are permitted after a specified participation period.

fields.name: Enter the number of years participation (no less than 5)
fields.desc: Enter the minimum number of years (at least 5) of participation required to trigger withdrawals from the Non-Elective Contribution Account.

fields.name: In-service withdrawals allowed from Matching Contribution Accounts on funds held for a specified period
fields.desc: Specify that withdrawals from the Matching Contribution Account are allowed on funds held for a specified period; if the service requirement is met before age 59½, withdrawals are restricted to funds not used for safe harbor purposes until age 59½.

fields.name: In-service withdrawals allowed from Non-Elective Contribution Account on funds held for a specified period
fields.desc: Indicate that withdrawals from the Non-Elective Contribution Account are allowed on funds held for a specified period.

fields.name: Enter the number of years funds must be held in plan (no less than 2)
fields.desc: Enter the minimum number of years (at least 2) that funds must be held before a withdrawal from the Non-Elective Contribution Account is permitted.

fields.name: In-service withdrawals allowed from Voluntary Contribution Account at any time
fields.desc: Indicate that withdrawals from the Voluntary Contribution Account are permitted at any time.

fields.name: In-service withdrawals allowed from Rollover Account at any time
fields.desc: Indicate that withdrawals from the Rollover Contribution Account are permitted at any time.

fields.name: Permit Qualified Reservist Distributions
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' to permit distributions for qualified reservists who meet these criteria: active duty for over 179 days (or indefinitely), ordered or called after September 11, 2001, and the distribution complies with Code section 72(t)(2)(G)(iii); otherwise, select 'No'.

fields.name: Permit Deemed Severance Distributions
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' to permit deemed severance distributions for participants in uniformed services under Section 414(u)(12)(B) and Notice 2010-15, with the condition that no elective deferrals are made during the 6-month period following the distribution; select 'No' if not permitted.

title: G - In-service Withdrawals : Transfer Account at Age 62

fields.name: Permit a distribution to be made to a Participant who has attained age 62 and who has not separated from employment from the Transfer Account
fields.desc: Allows a distribution from the Transfer Account for participants who have reached age 62 and remain employed. This provision applies only if F.7a is 'Yes' (i.e., the plan has received a transfer of assets from a plan subject to survivor annuity rules under Code sections 401(a)(11) and 417).

fields.name: Describe the limitations if "Yes - limited distribution options" is selected
fields.desc: Specify any restrictions on the distribution. For example: 'An active Participant who has attained age 62 may request a distribution from his/her Transfer Account only in the form of a Single Lump Sum Payment.'

title: G - In-service Withdrawals : Disability Distributions

fields.name: Allow in-service distributions upon Disability
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if in-service distributions are available to a Participant who is Disabled as defined in the Plan, and 'No' if not. Note that withdrawals from the Elective Deferral Account, Qualified Non-Elective Contribution Account, and portions of the Matching Contribution Account used to satisfy safe harbor requirements are only permitted if the disability is severe—meaning the Participant is unable to engage in any substantial gainful activity due to a medically determinable physical or mental impairment that is expected to result in death or last at least 12 continuous months—with such impairment supported by medical evidence.

title: G - In-service Withdrawals : Vesting Status for In-Service Withdrawals

fields.name: In-service withdrawals are allowed only if the distributing Account is fully vested
fields.desc: Withdrawals are permitted only from the fully vested portion of a participant's account unless otherwise specified in G.12a.

title: G - In-service Withdrawals : Other Conditions/Limitations

fields.name: Limitations, conditions and/or special rules apply to in-service withdrawals
fields.desc: Specify any limitations, conditions, or special rules for in-service withdrawals. These limitations must be applied consistently and nondiscriminatorily (e.g., limiting the number of withdrawals within a specified period).

fields.name: Describe the limitations, conditions and/or special rules that apply to in-service withdrawals
fields.desc: Provide a clear description of these limitations or rules. For example: 'A Participant awaiting a disability determination from the Social Security Administration may take an immediate in-service withdrawal if they can demonstrate a concern of imminent death.'

title: G - In-service Withdrawals : In-Plan Roth Rollovers

fields.name: In-Plan Roth Rollovers permitted (if Plan provides for Roth contributions)
fields.desc: Select the option that best describes the plan's policy on In-Plan Roth Rollovers. Options range from not permitting any rollovers ('No') to allowing rollovers without limitations ('Yes - no limitations'), permitting them only if the plan already permits distributions ('Yes - if the Plan otherwise allows for the distribution'), permitting all distributions at a specified age ('Yes - all distributions allowed under the Code at specified age'), or permitting rollovers subject to specific limitations ('Yes - limitations and/or conditions'). Note that funds used for safe harbor purposes (Elective Deferrals, QNECs, and Qualified Matching Contributions) cannot be withdrawn until age 59½.

fields.name: Describe the limitations and/or conditions
fields.desc: Provide a clear, objective description of any restrictions on In-Plan Roth Rollovers. For example: 'A terminated Participant may not request an In-Plan Roth Rollover.'

fields.name: Describe attainment age for distributions/in-service withdrawals
fields.desc: Enter the minimum age at which distributions or in-service withdrawals are permitted from the Roth Elective Deferral Account. This must be at least 59½ for contributions used for safe harbor purposes.

fields.name: Indicate whether In-Plan Roth Rollovers are permitted from partially vested accounts
Method of preserving Code section 411(d)(6) protected benefits
If "Other", describe the method to preserve Code section 411(d)(6) protected benefits

title: G - In-service Withdrawals : In-Plan Roth Transfers (amounts not otherwise distributable)

fields.name: If the Plan allows for Roth contributions, In-Plan Roth Transfers are permitted:
fields.desc: Select the appropriate option to indicate if In-Plan Roth Transfers are permitted for amounts that are not otherwise distributable. Options include: 'No' (transfers not allowed), 'Yes' (transfers allowed without limitations), or 'Yes - limitations or conditions' (transfers allowed under specific terms, such as being limited to currently employed Participants). Assets transferred will continue to carry the distribution restrictions that applied before the transfer.

fields.name: Describe limitations or conditions:
fields.desc: Provide a clear, objective description of any limitations or conditions that apply to In-Plan Roth Transfers. For example: 'Transfers are limited to currently employed Participants' or any other restrictions that ensure transferred assets retain their original distribution limitations.

title: H - Plan Operations, Trust & Top Heavy : Permitted Investments

fields.name: Restrict investment in "qualifying employer securities" and "qualifying employer real property"
fields.desc: Choose 'No' to allow up to 100% investment in qualifying employer securities and real property. (This does not apply to accounts limited to 10% under ERISA section 407(b)(2)).

fields.name: Describe any restrictions on investing in "qualifying employer securities" or "qualifying employer real property"
fields.desc: Provide details of any imposed restrictions on such investments. Restrictions must meet the nondiscrimination standards of Code section 401(a)(4).

fields.name: Restrict the Accounts which can invest in "qualifying employer securities" and "qualifying employer real property"
fields.desc: Indicate which types of plan accounts are allowed or restricted from investing in qualifying employer securities and real property.

fields.name: Elective Deferral Account
fields.desc: Pertains to the Elective Deferral Account.

fields.name: Employer Matching Contribution Account
fields.desc: Pertains to the Employer Matching Contribution Account.

fields.name: Voluntary Contribution Account
fields.desc: Pertains to the Voluntary Contribution Account.

fields.name: Non-Elective Contribution Account
fields.desc: Pertains to the Non-Elective Contribution Account.

fields.name: Qualified Non-Elective Contribution Account
fields.desc: Pertains to the Qualified Non-Elective Contribution Account.

fields.name: Rollover Contribution Account
fields.desc: Pertains to the Rollover Contribution Account.

fields.name: Transfer Account
fields.desc: Pertains to the Transfer Account.

fields.name: Restrict distributions of "qualifying employer securities" or "qualifying employer real property"
fields.desc: Set restrictions on how distributions of qualifying employer securities or real property are made. These restrictions must comply with Code section 401(a)(4) nondiscrimination requirements.

fields.name: If "Yes", the following restrictions will apply:
fields.desc: Describe the specific distribution restrictions, ensuring they satisfy nondiscrimination requirements.

fields.name: Plan may invest in life insurance
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if participants may elect to invest in life insurance policies; select 'No' if such investments are not permitted.

fields.name: Participant may invest in a QLAC
fields.desc: Indicate whether the plan allows participants to invest in a Qualified Longevity Annuity Contract (QLAC).

title: H - Plan Operations, Trust & Top Heavy : Participant Self Direction

fields.name: Specify the extent to which the Plan permits Participant self-direction and indicate the Plan's intent to comply with ERISA section 404(c)
fields.desc: Select 'None' if there are no participant-directed accounts. Otherwise, choose the option that best describes the plan’s self-direction policy, indicating whether all or some participant accounts are self-directed and if the plan complies with ERISA Section 404(c). The Summary Plan Description will reflect this intent.

fields.name: Self direct Elective Deferral Account
fields.desc: Specify whether participants are allowed to direct the investment of their Elective Deferral Account.

fields.name: Self direct Matching Contribution Account
fields.desc: Indicate if participants may direct investments within their Employer Matching Contribution Account.

fields.name: Self direct Voluntary Contribution Account
fields.desc: Specify whether participants can control investment decisions for their Voluntary Contribution Account.

fields.name: Self direct Non-Elective Contribution Account
fields.desc: Indicate if the plan permits participant-directed investment in the Non-Elective Contribution Account.

fields.name: Self direct Qualified Nonelective Contribution Account
fields.desc: State whether participants have self-direction options for the Qualified Nonelective Contribution Account.

fields.name: Self direct Rollover Contribution Account
fields.desc: Specify if participants can direct investments within their Rollover Contribution Account.

fields.name: Self direct Transfer Account
fields.desc: Indicate whether the Transfer Account is participant-directed.

fields.name: Self direct Other Account
fields.desc: Specify if there are any other types of accounts that allow participant self-direction.

fields.name: If "Other", describe Account
fields.desc: Provide a description of the 'Other' account type(s) that permit participant self-direction.

fields.name: Participants may also establish individual brokerage accounts
fields.desc: Indicate whether participants are permitted to set up individual brokerage accounts in addition to any self-directed accounts offered by the plan.

fields.name: Participants may exercise voting rights with respect to the following investments (If 404(c) applies and employer securities are allowed then voting rights may not be "None")
fields.desc: Specify the extent to which participants may exercise voting rights over their investments. This option cannot be 'None' if the plan allows investments in qualifying employer securities and is intended to meet ERISA Section 404(c) requirements.

fields.name: Describe the investments where Participants may exercise voting rights
fields.desc: Provide details on which investments (e.g., qualifying employer securities) participants are entitled to vote on.

title: H - Plan Operations, Trust & Top Heavy : Valuation Date

fields.name: Enter Valuation Date (if 404(c) applies, then Valuation Date must be at least quarterly)
fields.desc: Enter the valuation date used to determine the Trust's asset values. If the plan is intended to comply with ERISA Section 404(c), the valuation must occur at least on a quarterly basis.

fields.name: If "Other", enter Valuation Date (must be at least annually)
fields.desc: Provide an alternative valuation date if 'Other' is selected. This date must be at least annual, but if the plan is to comply with ERISA Section 404(c), it must be at least quarterly.

title: H - Plan Operations, Trust & Top Heavy : Plan Administration

fields.name: Designation of Plan Administrator
fields.desc: Identify the individual or entity designated as the Plan Administrator.

fields.name: If "Other", Name of Plan Administrator
fields.desc: Provide the name of the Plan Administrator if 'Other' is selected.

fields.name: Establishment of procedures for the Plan Administrator and the Investment Fiduciary
fields.desc: Select who sets the procedures for the Plan Administrator and Investment Fiduciary: either they adopt their own rules or the Board sets the procedures.

fields.name: The Trustee is also the Investment Fiduciary (Section 11.02)
fields.desc: Indicate whether the Trustee also acts as the Investment Fiduciary.

fields.name: If "No", identify the Investment Fiduciary
fields.desc: Provide the name of the designated Investment Fiduciary if the Trustee is not serving in that role.

fields.name: Type of indemnification for the Plan Administrator and Investment Fiduciary
fields.desc: Choose the type of indemnification provided: 'None' (no indemnification), 'Standard' (per Section 11.06), or 'Custom' (with a separate indemnification policy).

fields.name: Modifications shall be made to the duties of applicable parties
fields.desc: Indicate if there are any changes to the standard duties, such as reallocating responsibilities between the Plan Sponsor and the Plan Administrator or assigning additional duties.

fields.name: Describe the modifications of duties of applicable parties
fields.desc: Provide a clear description of any modifications to duties, ensuring that reassignments are consistent and nondiscriminatory.

title: H - Plan Operations, Trust & Top Heavy : Claims Procedure Limitations

fields.name: The Plan has claims procedure limitations
fields.desc: Specify that the plan’s claims procedures are subject to limitations that comply with DOL regulations and other applicable guidance.

fields.name: Describe claims procedure limitations
fields.desc: Provide a detailed description of the limitations, conditions, or special rules that govern the claims procedure, ensuring compliance with DOL requirements.
