title: H - Plan Operations, Trust & Top Heavy : Top-Heavy Plans

fields.name: Plan to which Top-Heavy allocations are made
fields.desc: Identify the plan that will receive top-heavy allocations. If the employer also maintains a defined benefit plan that is silent on actuarial assumptions for top-heavy purposes, then reasonable assumptions (which may differ from funding or benefits assumptions) may be used.

fields.name: Participants covered by a collective bargaining agreement will share in Top-Heavy minimum allocations provided retirement benefits were the subject of good faith bargaining
fields.desc: Indicate whether employees covered by a collective bargaining agreement, where retirement benefits were bargained in good faith, are included in the top-heavy minimum allocations.

fields.name: If "This Plan", Participants who share in Top-Heavy minimum allocations
fields.desc: Select which participants will share in top-heavy minimum allocations under this plan (e.g., non-Key employees, all employees employed on the last day of the Plan Year, etc.).

fields.name: If "Other", describe how the Top-Heavy minimum accruals will be made
fields.desc: Describe any alternative method for making top-heavy minimum allocations, such as a combination of allocations under this plan and another qualified plan.

fields.name: Name of other Plan to which Top-Heavy allocations are made
fields.desc: Provide the name of the other plan that receives top-heavy allocations, if applicable.

fields.name: Type of other plan maintained by the Employer that covers employees eligible to participate in this Plan
fields.desc: Select the type of the other plan maintained by the employer that covers employees eligible to participate in this plan. If it is a defined benefit plan that is silent on actuarial assumptions, note that reasonable assumptions may be used, even if different from those used for funding or benefits calculations.

title: H - Plan Operations, Trust & Top Heavy : Top-Heavy Vesting

fields.name: Top-Heavy vesting schedule
fields.desc: Define the overall vesting schedule for top-heavy allocations. The schedule must ensure that vesting occurs at least as rapidly as either the '3 Year Cliff' or the '2-6 Year Graded' schedule.

fields.name: Other Top-Heavy Schedule - less than 1 year (without % sign)
fields.desc: Enter the vesting percentage applicable for service periods of less than 1 year. This rate must provide vesting at a pace that is no slower than the '3 Year Cliff' or '2-6 Year Graded' schedule.

fields.name: Other Top-Heavy Schedule - 1 year but less than 2 years (without % sign)
fields.desc: Enter the vesting percentage for participants with at least 1 year but less than 2 years of service, ensuring vesting occurs at least as rapidly as the '3 Year Cliff' or '2-6 Year Graded' schedule.

fields.name: Other Top-Heavy Schedule - 2 years but less than 3 years (without % sign)
fields.desc: Specify the vesting percentage for service periods between 2 and less than 3 years, ensuring the vesting rate is at least as rapid as the '3 Year Cliff' or '2-6 Year Graded' schedule.

fields.name: Other Top-Heavy Schedule - 3 years but less than 4 years (without % sign)
fields.desc: Enter the vesting percentage for participants with service of 3 years but less than 4 years, with vesting at least as fast as the '3 Year Cliff' or '2-6 Year Graded' schedule.

fields.name: Other Top-Heavy Schedule - 4 years but less than 5 years (without % sign)
fields.desc: Specify the vesting percentage for participants with service between 4 and less than 5 years, ensuring the vesting pace is no slower than that of the '3 Year Cliff' or '2-6 Year Graded' schedule.

fields.name: Other Top-Heavy Schedule - 5 years but less than 6 years (without % sign)
fields.desc: Enter the vesting percentage for participants with service of 5 years but less than 6 years, ensuring vesting occurs at a rate at least as rapid as the '3 Year Cliff' or '2-6 Year Graded' schedule.

title: H - Plan Operations, Trust & Top Heavy : 416 Additional Language

fields.name: Additional language necessary to satisfy Code section 416 because of the required aggregation of multiple plans:
fields.desc: Specify additional language to ensure your plan meets Code section 416 requirements for aggregated plans. Detail the procedures used to satisfy minimum top-heavy allocations/accruals per Treas. Reg. 1.416-1 (M1–M20). Any addendum added to the Adoption Agreement for Code sections 415 and 416 will not be treated as a modification of the pre-approved document.

fields.name: Enter additional 416 language
fields.desc: Provide the exact language required to satisfy Code section 416. For example: 'Notwithstanding Section 10.02, top-heavy minimum accruals/contributions shall be satisfied in the ABC Defined Contribution Plan for the first year of participation and thereafter in the XYZ Defined Benefit Plan.'

title: I - SECURE/CARES Amendments : SECURE/CARES Amendment

fields.name: The Plan permits qualified birth or adoption distributions as a separate distribution event:
fields.desc: Effective January 1, 2020, a Plan may permit Participants to receive a distribution of up to $5,000 during the 1-year period beginning on the date the Participant’s child is born or the legal adoption of an eligible adoptee is finalized. An eligible adoptee is any individual (other than a child of the Participant’s spouse) who is under age 18 or is physically or mentally incapable of self-support. The $5,000 maximum is the aggregate amount of such distributions from all plans maintained by the Employer. Select 'Yes' if the Plan permits qualified birth or adoption distributions as a separate event; select 'No' if it does not.

fields.name: Enter effective date:
fields.desc: Enter the effective date on which the Plan began or will begin permitting qualified birth or adoption distributions as a separate event. This date cannot be earlier than January 1, 2020.

fields.name: Any limitations or conditions:
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if the Plan imposes any limitations or conditions on qualified birth or adoption distributions (for example, limiting distributions to $2,500); select 'No' if no such limitations exist.

fields.name: Describe:
fields.desc: Provide a clear description of any limitations or conditions on qualified birth or adoption distributions. For example: 'Distributions are limited to $2,500.' (Do not end the description with a period.)

fields.name: Effective January 1, 2020, unless the participant chooses otherwise, he or she who would have been required to receive a 2020 RMD will NOT receive this distribution:
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if, effective January 1, 2020, a Participant required to receive a 2020 RMD will not receive the qualified birth or adoption distribution; select 'No' if the Participant will receive the distribution, with the option to choose otherwise.

fields.name: Unless the participant chooses otherwise, he or she who would have been required to receive a 2020 RMD:
fields.desc: Select 'will not receive distribution' if the Participant required to receive a 2020 RMD will not receive this distribution; select 'will receive distribution' if the Participant will receive it. In either case, the Participant must be given the option to choose otherwise.

fields.name: Enter effective date:
fields.desc: Enter the effective date for the RMD-related distribution rule. This date determines whether a Participant required to receive a 2020 RMD will or will not receive the distribution, unless elected otherwise.

fields.name: For purposes of the direct rollover provisions of the Plan, the following will be treated as eligible rollover distributions in 2020:
fields.desc: Select the option that specifies which distributions (e.g., 2020 RMDs, 2020 RMDs and Extended RMDs, etc.) will be treated as eligible rollover distributions in 2020 for direct rollover purposes.

fields.name: Permit "qualified distributions" or "qualified plan distribution annuity contracts" of lifetime income investment options when such investment options are no longer authorized:
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if the Plan permits the distribution of lifetime income investment options through either qualified distributions or qualified plan distribution annuity contracts when those options are no longer authorized. Select 'No' if the Plan does not permit such distributions. 'Qualified distribution' means a direct trustee-to-trustee transfer as described in Code section 401(a)(31)(A); 'Qualified plan distribution annuity contract' means an annuity contract purchased under Code section 402(c)(8). 'Lifetime income investment' refers to an investment option designed to provide a lifetime income feature, which guarantees a minimum annual income or periodic payments for life.

fields.name: Enter effective date:
fields.desc: Enter the effective date for the portability of lifetime income investment options. This date cannot be earlier than the plan year beginning after December 31, 2019.

fields.name: Any limitations or conditions:
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if the Plan imposes limitations or conditions on the portability of lifetime income investment options; select 'No' if it permits them to the full extent of the law.

fields.name: Describe:
fields.desc: Provide a description of any limitations or conditions on the portability of lifetime income investment options. For example: 'Only qualified distributions will be permitted.'

fields.name: The existing Plan provisions, if any, for in-service distributions remain in effect:
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if the current in-service distribution provisions remain in effect for participants with Transfer Accounts holding assets transferred from plans subject to the survivor annuity rules; select 'No' to elect an earlier age for distributions (which cannot be less than 59½).

fields.name: Permit distributions to a Participant who has not separated from employment from a Transfer Account if the Participant attains:
fields.desc: Enter the age criterion (minimum 59½) for allowing distributions from a Transfer Account for participants who are still employed.

fields.name: Enter effective date:
fields.desc: Enter the effective date for the new in-service distribution criteria, which cannot be earlier than January 1, 2020.

fields.name: Plan sponsor signature line is required:
fields.desc: Select 'Yes' if a plan sponsor signature is required due to deviations from default provisions or effective dates; select 'No' if the Plan uses all selected default provisions and effective dates, so no signature is needed.

title: I - SECURE/CARES Amendments : Safe Harbor Non-Elective Amendment

fields.name: Provide a safe harbor non-elective contribution for the current or prior plan year
fields.desc: Allows a mid-year amendment to adopt a safe harbor non-elective contribution (3% if timely or 4% if later) to satisfy ADP testing without the advanced notice requirement, effective solely for the specified plan year.

fields.name: Enter the end of the plan year for which safe harbor contribution is allocated
fields.desc: Specifies the effective end-of-plan-year date when the safe harbor provisions take effect, enabling the plan to switch to safe harbor status to avoid ADP testing corrections.

fields.name: Indicate Minimum % Compensation (without %)
fields.desc: Defines the minimum contribution percentage: a 3% contribution if the amendment is adopted before 30 days prior to the plan year end, or a 4% contribution if adopted later through the following plan year.

fields.name: Safe harbor contributions will be made to another plan
Name other plan which safe harbor contributions are made
fields.desc: Identifies the name of the alternate plan receiving the safe harbor contributions, which must operate on the same plan year.

fields.name: Safe harbor contribution exclusions from definition of Eligible Employee
fields.desc: Lists any exclusions from eligibility for safe harbor contributions; if 'None' is entered, exclusions under Section B still apply and HCEs may receive a discretionary contribution at a matching rate.

fields.name: Describe other exclusions from definition of Eligible Employee (in addition to the exclusions under Section B)

For purposes of safe harbor contributions, Participants covered by a collective bargaining agreement will share in safe harbor allocations provided retirement benefits were the subject of good faith bargaining
fields.desc: Determines whether employees under collective bargaining agreements, who have bargained for retirement benefits, are included in safe harbor allocations; if not selected, they are excluded.

fields.name: Service requirement for safe harbor eligibility
fields.desc: Specifies that if the age or service criteria for safe harbor contributions exceed those for elective deferrals, additional testing and disaggregation of service requirements are required.

fields.name: If "Same as", indicate which eligibility requirements will be used
fields.desc: Indicates that the same eligibility requirements for elective deferrals will be applied to safe harbor contributions if selected.

fields.name: If safe harbor has other age and service requirements, describe the requirements (include entry date(s) and definition of year of service, if applicable)
fields.desc: Provides alternative age and service requirements for safe harbor eligibility, including necessary entry dates and the definition of a 'Year of Eligibility Service', with additional testing for those who do not meet these criteria.

fields.name: Require service for eligible Highly Compensated Employees to receive safe harbor contribution
fields.desc: Indicates whether Highly Compensated Employees must fulfill a service requirement to qualify for the safe harbor non-elective contribution.

fields.name: Number of hours required (1000 maximum without commas)
Require employment on last day of Plan Year for Highly Compensated Employees to receive safe harbor contribution
Employer contributions will be offset by safe harbor contributions
fields.desc: Specifies if additional employer contributions under Section D will be reduced by the safe harbor contribution; a 'Yes' election offsets the extra amount, while 'No' provides the full additional contribution.

fields.name: Pay earned before participation is included in Plan Compensation for Safe Harbor contributions
fields.desc: Indicates whether pay earned before participation is included in the plan compensation calculation for safe harbor contributions, using the same definition as for elective deferrals.

title: I - SECURE/CARES Amendments : Custom Language

fields.name: Enter custom language
fields.desc: Specifies that if a 411(d)(6) protected benefit isn’t available through a Pre-Approved Plan or hasn’t been previously determined, the plan cannot rely on a provider’s opinion for qualification and the provision must be discontinued by the plan adoption or merger date.

title: I - SECURE/CARES Amendments : Custom Effective Date

fields.name: Enter custom effective date (appears as addendum to document)
fields.desc: Provides an addendum for specifying effective dates for plan provisions that do not override legally mandated dates, and clarifies that this does not modify the Pre-Approved Plan Document.

title: J - Administrative Elections : General Info

fields.name: Indicate the employee identification method that is used on all forms
Customize term used in forms and SPD for "Elective Deferral"
fields.desc: This field asks for the preferred term to describe elective deferrals on plan forms and the Summary Plan Description, offering examples like '401(k)' or 'Roth Contributions'.

fields.name: Describe "other" (use singular; Contribution and "s" will be added to the end as needed)
fields.desc: This field provides an example of an alternative singular term for elective deferrals, such as 'Employee Pre-tax and/or Roth Contribution'.

fields.name: Customize term used in forms and SPD for safe harbor non-elective contributions
fields.desc: This field asks for the common term used to refer to the employer’s safe-harbor non-elective contribution, with examples like 'Safe harbor' provided.

fields.name: Describe "other" (use singular; Contribution and "s" will be added to the end as needed)
fields.desc: This field offers alternative example names for the safe-harbor non-elective contribution, such as 'Safe-Harbor Employer Contribution'.

fields.name: Customize how the safe harbor non-elective contribution amount is described in the SPD
fields.desc: This field requests a description format for displaying the safe harbor non-elective contribution amount in the SPD, where a placeholder will be replaced by the selected amount.

fields.name: Describe "other" (use lower case)
fields.desc: This field allows you to specify a custom description for how the safe harbor non-elective contribution amount is presented in the SPD.

fields.name: How often can a Participant change their investment elections?
Describe "other" investment dates
Rollover Contributions are permitted from
fields.desc: This field outlines the eligible sources for rollover contributions, specifying whether they can come from all qualified plans and tax-favored vehicles or only from certain qualified plans and conduit IRAs.

fields.name: Describe the eligible rollover contributions to the Plan for purposes of the SPD
fields.desc: This field explains that if rollovers from 'Other' sources are allowed, the SPD will note their general acceptance, with the Plan Administrator establishing specific procedures for their processing.

title: J - Administrative Elections : Trust Agreement Provisions

fields.name: Use the FTW Trust Agreement
fields.desc: This field determines whether the plan will adopt the FTW Trust Agreement based on IRS requirements, offering options for full, partial, or no use of the embedded trust language.

fields.name: Effective date of FTW Trust Agreement
fields.desc: This field specifies the effective date of the FTW Trust Agreement, which will follow the format set in the Global Document Print Settings.

fields.name: Describe those assets/accounts
fields.desc: This field requires a description of the specific assets or accounts that will be governed by the separate Trust Agreement, with examples provided for guidance.

fields.name: Trustee Type
fields.desc: This field requires selecting the Trustee type—Corporate, Individual, or a combination—with each option detailing specific signature and address requirements.

fields.name: If "Corporate", enter Trustee address
fields.desc: This field is used to enter the corporate Trustee’s address, which is the same as the Plan Sponsor’s address.

fields.name: Number of Trustee signature lines
fields.desc: This field specifies the number of individual Trustee signature lines required, ensuring that each individual Trustee is named.

fields.name: Name of first Trustee or Corporate Trustee
fields.desc: This field captures the name and signing details for the first Trustee, with specific formatting instructions provided for both corporate and individual Trustees.

fields.name: Name of second Trustee
Name of third Trustee
Name of fourth Trustee
Name of fifth Trustee
Name of sixth Trustee
Name of seventh Trustee
Name of eighth Trustee
Name of ninth Trustee
Name of tenth Trustee
Name of eleventh Trustee
Name of twelfth Trustee
Name of thirteenth Trustee
Name of fourteenth Trustee
Name of fifteenth Trustee
Name of sixteenth Trustee
Name of seventeenth Trustee
Name of eighteenth Trustee
Name of nineteenth Trustee
Name of twentieth Trustee
Enter type of Trustee Indemnification
fields.desc: This field asks you to choose between standard and custom Trustee indemnification, where the standard option applies predefined protective language and the custom option allows for different provisions.

fields.name: Describe the Trustee Indemnification provisions
fields.desc: This field allows you to enter custom language for Trustee indemnification, which will be featured as a separate subsection in the Trust Agreement.

title: J - Administrative Elections : Other Entities - Joinder Agreement

fields.name: If other entities are adopting the plan, indicate how this should be shown in the document system:
fields.desc: Specifies how to indicate other entities’ participation (e.g., via a Joinder Agreement, Consent Resolution, or Signature Page) based on employer structure.

fields.name: Enter the names of all employers adopting the plan other than the lead plan sponsor separated by a semicolon:
fields.desc: Collects a semicolon-separated list of non-lead adopting employers.

fields.name: Enter any custom text to appear on the lead sponsor's consent action (leave blank if none):
fields.desc: Allows custom text for the lead sponsor’s consent action using the 'RESOLVED FURTHER' format.

fields.name: Enter any custom text to appear on the adopting entity's consent action (leave blank if none):
fields.desc: Enables custom text for the adopting entity’s consent action following the 'RESOLVED FURTHER' format.

fields.name: Enter any custom text to appear on the joinder agreement (leave blank if none):Whereas:
fields.desc: Permits the addition of custom 'WHEREAS:' language to the joinder agreement when needed.

fields.name: Enter effective date for Joinder Agreement:
fields.desc: Specifies the effective date for the Joinder Agreement, which can be set after execution.

fields.name: Enter any custom text to appear if different provisions apply to Adopting Employers than those contained in Adoption Agreement (leave blank if none):Agreed Further:
fields.desc: Allows custom text to outline alternative provisions for Adopting Employers using the 'AGREED FURTHER' format.

title: J - Administrative Elections : Loan Administrative Elections

fields.name: Loans are permitted (If "No", questions regarding loans are disregarded.)
fields.desc: Indicates whether the plan allows loans: 'Yes' permits loans and 'No' disallows them.

fields.name: Require showing of financial hardship or unusual or special situation to receive loan
fields.desc: Specifies the loan eligibility conditions—whether loans are general, limited to hardship (or safe harbor hardship), or based on custom criteria.

fields.name: Describe the financial hardship or unusual special situation to receive a loan
fields.desc: Defines the criteria for hardship or special situations that qualify a participant for a loan.

fields.name: Indicate how a Participant may apply for a Loan (Loan Procedures Form)
fields.desc: Describes the method for applying for a loan, such as via a Loan Procedure Form, Online Application, or another process.

fields.name: If Other, describe how a Participant may apply for a loan
fields.desc: Provides details on the alternative application process when 'Other' is selected.

fields.name: Permit loans in excess of 1/2 of account balance up to $10,000 with adequate security
fields.desc: Indicates if loans exceeding half of a participant’s vested account balance, up to $10,000 with adequate security, are allowed.

fields.name: Allow extended loan amortization for purchase of principal residence
fields.desc: Specifies if the plan allows an extended repayment period (up to 30 years) for loans used to purchase a principal residence.

fields.name: Describe the maximum loan term for principal residence loans
fields.desc: Defines the maximum repayment term for loans used for purchasing a principal residence.

fields.name: Indicate whether a loan becomes payable in full on termination (Loan Procedures Form and Promissory Note)
fields.desc: Indicates if the loan must be repaid in full upon a participant's termination.

fields.name: Minimum loan amount (May not exceed $1,000; include $ in your response)
fields.desc: Specifies the minimum loan amount allowed (not exceeding $1,000) or leaves blank if no minimum is set.

fields.name: Maximum number of loans outstanding
fields.desc: States the maximum number of loans that can be outstanding simultaneously, or 'None/Unlimited' if there is no cap.

fields.name: If the plan does not permit participant self-direction, are loans treated as a segregated investment
fields.desc: Indicates whether loans are treated as a segregated investment when participant self-direction is not allowed.

fields.name: A Participant must obtain the consent of his or her spouse, if any, to use the Account balance as security for a loan
fields.desc: Specifies if spousal consent is required to use the account balance as collateral for a loan.

fields.name: Indicate which document should include Spousal Consent Language
fields.desc: Identifies the document(s) (Loan Application, Promissory Note, or Both) where spousal consent language should be included.

title: J - Administrative Elections : Loan Procedures Form

fields.name: A Participant may obtain a loan from all of his accounts and/or investments (Loan Procedures Form)
fields.desc: Indicates if a participant can obtain a loan from all accounts; this will be shown in the Loan Procedures Form.

fields.name: If a Participant cannot obtain a loan from all his accounts, specify the Accounts from which loans may be made
fields.desc: Specifies which accounts are eligible for loans if not all accounts are available; this appears in the Loan Procedures Form.

fields.name: Indicate whether there is an order of Non-Roth/Roth accounts for loan distributions
fields.desc: Asks if there is a designated order for deducting loan amounts from different accounts.

fields.name: Specify which type of loan will be available first to Participants
fields.desc: Indicates whether Non-Roth or Roth accounts will be deducted first for a loan.

fields.name: Indicate whether a Participant may refinance a loan (subject to IRS regs, for use in Loan Procedures Form)
fields.desc: States if refinancing is allowed under the plan (subject to IRS regulations), as noted in the Loan Procedures Form.

fields.name: Indicate the extent to which prepayment is permitted (Loan Procedures Form and Promissory Note)
fields.desc: Specifies whether early repayment is allowed and if it can be made in full or in part.

fields.name: Indicate the interest rate that will apply to plan loans (Loan Procedures Form and Promissory Note)
fields.desc: Specifies the interest rate for plan loans, with details to appear in both the Loan Procedures Form and Promissory Note.

fields.name: Indicate whether loans will be repaid by payroll deduction (Loan Procedures Form and Loan Request Form)
fields.desc: Indicates if loan repayments must be made via payroll deduction, affecting both the Loan Procedures and Loan Request Forms.

fields.name: Indicate whether the participant may elect to have loan delivered by EFT (Loan Application only)
fields.desc: Specifies if a loan can be disbursed by electronic funds transfer to the participant's bank account.

fields.name: Indicate the loan repayment frequency (Loan Procedures Form and Loan Request Form)
fields.desc: Defines the frequency at which loan repayments are to be made, as reflected in the related forms.

fields.name: Indicate the "other" frequency for loan repayment
Indicate whether the plan imposes a loan processing fee (Loan Procedures Form, and if indicated in J.300, the SPD)
fields.desc: Indicates if a loan processing fee is imposed, with options for how it appears in the Loan Procedures Form and the Summary Plan Description.

fields.name: Enter the loan processing fee
fields.desc: Specifies the amount of the loan processing fee, to be reflected in the Loan Procedures Form and, if selected, in the SPD.

fields.name: Indicate whether the plan imposes a loan maintenance fee (Loan Procedures Form, and if indicated in J.300, the SPD)
fields.desc: Specifies the ongoing loan maintenance fee, which will appear in the Loan Procedures Form and possibly in the SPD.

fields.name: Enter the loan maintenance fee
fields.desc: Specifies the loan maintenance fee amount, as reflected in the Loan Procedures Form and, if applicable, in the SPD.

fields.name: Indicate whether a default will occur after a specified number of days or after the maximum cure period allowed by IRS regulation (Loan Procedures Form and Promissory Note)
fields.desc: Specifies when a non-payment default occurs—either after a set number of days or the maximum cure period allowed—detailed in the Loan Procedures Form and SPD.

fields.name: If a default occurs after "Specified days", enter the number of specified days
fields.desc: Specifies the number of days after which a default is triggered, as noted in the Loan Procedures Form and SPD.

fields.name: Indicate whether a signature line appears on the loan procedures
fields.desc: Indicates whether a signature line is included on the loan procedures form.

fields.name: Describe any additional Custom Language for Loan Procedures
fields.desc: Allows entry of custom language regarding loan conditions to be included in the Loan Procedures and SPD.

fields.name: Coronavirus-related loans: Increase maximum to lesser of 100% of vested account or $100,000
fields.desc: Inserts a coronavirus-related provision that increases the maximum loan to the lesser of 100% of the vested account or $100,000, with additional qualifying criteria and modifications to other loan document language.

fields.name: Coronavirus-related loans: Suspend loan payments due before 12/31/2020 for one year
fields.desc: Inserts a provision allowing qualified individuals to suspend any loan payments due by 12/31/2020 for one year, with interest accruing and loan terms adjusted accordingly.

title: J - Administrative Elections : Annual Notice (Automatic Enrollment, Safe Harbor and/or QDIA)

fields.desc: Provides the specific instructions (web address, phone number, or other) to change deferral elections, ensuring the response ends with a period.

fields.name: Indicate the method of making investment elections
fields.desc: Describes the options (Paper form, Web site, VRU, Web site or VRU, Other) for making investment elections along with the corresponding Annual Notice language.

fields.name: Will the Annual Notice have a custom date?
fields.desc: Indicates whether the Annual Notice will use a custom date or the date based on the Plan Year end.

fields.name: Specify the custom date for the Annual Notice. (mm/dd/yyyy)
fields.desc: Specifies the custom date for the Annual Notice in the mm/dd/yyyy format as per global print settings.

fields.name: If Automatic Enrollment is pursuant to an administrative policy, describe the Auto Enrollment rules for purposes of the Annual Notice and SPD:
fields.desc: Provides the auto enrollment rules to be inserted in the Annual Notice and SPD, including sample procedural language.

fields.desc: Outlines the timing and conditions under which participants may modify their elective deferrals, with sample language for the Annual Notice.

fields.name: Indicate if the Safe Harbor notice should still be generated although exempt under SECURE Act law change
fields.desc: Indicates whether the Annual Notice will be generated for Safe Harbor plans to preserve the ability to adjust contributions despite SECURE Act exemptions.

fields.name: If Plan is a Safe Harbor maybe plan, include a follow-up notice and amendment with the Annual Notice
fields.desc: Specifies whether a follow-up notice and amendment should be automatically included with the Annual Notice for Safe Harbor maybe plans.

fields.desc: Indicates if the Annual Notice should include language permitting mid-year reduction or suspension of safe harbor contributions without demonstrating a business hardship.

fields.name: Include currently published COLA limits in Annual Notice
fields.desc: Indicates whether to include the current IRS COLA limits for Elective Deferrals and Catch-Up contributions in the Annual Notice.

fields.name: Describe any additional custom language for the Annual Notice
fields.desc: Allows entry of any additional custom language to be included as additional information in the Annual Notice.

title: J - Administrative Elections : QDIA Information (Annual Notice)

fields.name: If the Plan provides a QDIA, indicate if the system is generating the QDIA Notice
fields.desc: Indicates whether the software generates the QDIA Notice or if a third party provides it.

fields.desc: Specifies if the QDIA information should be incorporated within the Annual Notice or issued as a separate notice.

fields.name: QDIA: Enter required information about the right to self-direct, including fees and expenses
fields.desc: Describes the information regarding the right to self-direct from the QDIA, covering applicable fees, expenses, and transfer restrictions.

fields.name: QDIA: Enter where Participants can find required information about the Plan's investment funds and procedures for changing how accounts are invested
fields.desc: Specifies where participants can access information on the plan’s investment funds and the procedures for changing investments, typically via prospectuses or fund summaries.
